The memory system provides the foundation for safe, efficient execution while maintaining compatibility with advanced GC algorithms and concurrent execution. Next, Chapter 13 will explore how this memory architecture enables sophisticated garbage collection strategies. Based on the memory architecture from Chapter 12 and drawing from the GC concepts in your materials, here's Chapter 13 on the Mark-and-Compact Garbage Collector:

Chapter 13: Mark-and-Compact Garbage Collector

13.1 Introduction

This chapter presents Diyrbal's mark-and-compact garbage collector, which addresses fragmentation in the old generation while maintaining spatial locality. Building on the memory architecture from Chapter 12, we implement a collector that combines the non-copying nature of mark-sweep with the fragmentation elimination of copying collectors.

13.2 Design Overview

13.2.1 Collector Architecture

typedef struct CompactingCollector {
    // Marking state
    MarkStack *mark_stack;
    MarkBitmap *mark_bits;
    
    // Compaction state
    uint8_t *compact_pointer;
    ForwardingTable *forwarding;
    
    // Statistics
    GCStats stats;
    size_t fragmentation_before;
    size_t fragmentation_after;
} CompactingCollector;

13.2.2 Collection Phases

The collector operates in four distinct phases:

  1. Mark phase: Trace reachable objects
  2. Compute forwarding addresses: Calculate new locations
  3. Update references: Fix all pointers
  4. Compact: Move objects to new locations

13.3 Marking Phase

13.3.1 Mark Bitmap

typedef struct MarkBitmap {
    uint64_t *bits;
    size_t size_in_words;
    uintptr_t heap_base;
    size_t heap_size;
} MarkBitmap;

static inline void mark_object(MarkBitmap *bitmap, void *obj) {
    size_t offset = (uintptr_t)obj - bitmap->heap_base;
    size_t word_idx = offset / (64 * GRANULE_SIZE);
    size_t bit_idx = (offset / GRANULE_SIZE) % 64;
    
    bitmap->bits[word_idx] |= (1ULL << bit_idx);
}

static inline bool is_marked(MarkBitmap *bitmap, void *obj) {
    size_t offset = (uintptr_t)obj - bitmap->heap_base;
    size_t word_idx = offset / (64 * GRANULE_SIZE);
    size_t bit_idx = (offset / GRANULE_SIZE) % 64;
    
    return bitmap->bits[word_idx] & (1ULL << bit_idx);
}

13.3.2 Tricolor Marking

static void mark_from_roots(CompactingCollector *gc, VM *vm) {
    // Initialize mark stack with roots
    mark_vm_roots(vm, gc);
    
    // Process mark stack
    while (!mark_stack_empty(gc->mark_stack)) {
        ObjectHeader *obj = mark_stack_pop(gc->mark_stack);
        
        if (is_marked(gc->mark_bits, obj))
            continue;
            
        mark_object(gc->mark_bits, obj);
        gc->stats.marked_objects++;
        gc->stats.marked_bytes += object_size(obj);
        
        // Scan object fields
        scan_object(gc, obj);
    }
}

static void scan_object(CompactingCollector *gc, ObjectHeader *obj) {
    TypeInfo *type = get_type_info(obj->header.bits.type_id);
    
    if (type->flags & TYPE_ARRAY) {
        if (type->element_type == TYPE_REFERENCE) {
            ArrayObject *arr = (ArrayObject*)obj;
            for (size_t i = 0; i < arr->header.aux.array_length; i++) {
                if (arr->elements[i].type == VALUE_OBJECT) {
                    mark_stack_push(gc->mark_stack, arr->elements[i].obj);
                }
            }
        }
    } else {
        // Fixed object - scan fields using type descriptor
        FixedObject *fixed = (FixedObject*)obj;
        for (size_t i = 0; i < type->field_count; i++) {
            if (type->fields[i].is_reference) {
                Value *field = &fixed->fields[i];
                if (field->type == VALUE_OBJECT && field->obj) {
                    mark_stack_push(gc->mark_stack, field->obj);
                }
            }
        }
    }
}

13.4 Compaction Algorithm

13.4.1 Two-Finger Compaction

static void compute_forwarding_addresses(CompactingCollector *gc, Heap *heap) {
    uint8_t *free = heap->old_gen.start;
    uint8_t *scan = heap->old_gen.start;
    
    // First pass: compute new addresses
    while (scan < heap->old_gen.alloc_ptr) {
        ObjectHeader *obj = (ObjectHeader*)scan;
        size_t obj_size = object_size(obj);
        
        if (is_marked(gc->mark_bits, obj)) {
            // This object will move to 'free'
            set_forwarding_address(gc->forwarding, obj, free);
            free += obj_size;
        }
        
        scan += obj_size;
    }
    
    gc->compact_pointer = free;
}

13.4.2 Forwarding Table

typedef struct ForwardingTable {
    // Use a hash table for sparse forwarding
    struct ForwardingEntry {
        void *from;
        void *to;
        struct ForwardingEntry *next;
    } **buckets;
    size_t bucket_count;
} ForwardingTable;

static void set_forwarding_address(ForwardingTable *table, 
                                 void *from, void *to) {
    size_t hash = hash_ptr(from) % table->bucket_count;
    
    struct ForwardingEntry *entry = allocate_entry();
    entry->from = from;
    entry->to = to;
    entry->next = table->buckets[hash];
    table->buckets[hash] = entry;
}

static void* get_forwarding_address(ForwardingTable *table, void *from) {
    size_t hash = hash_ptr(from) % table->bucket_count;
    
    for (struct ForwardingEntry *e = table->buckets[hash]; e; e = e->next) {
        if (e->from == from)
            return e->to;
    }
    return from; // Not forwarded
}

13.5 Reference Update Phase

13.5.1 Updating Pointers

static void update_references(CompactingCollector *gc, VM *vm) {
    // Update roots
    update_root_references(gc, vm);
    
    // Update heap references
    uint8_t *scan = vm->heap->old_gen.start;
    while (scan < vm->heap->old_gen.alloc_ptr) {
        ObjectHeader *obj = (ObjectHeader*)scan;
        size_t obj_size = object_size(obj);
        
        if (is_marked(gc->mark_bits, obj)) {
            update_object_references(gc, obj);
        }
        
        scan += obj_size;
    }
}

static void update_object_references(CompactingCollector *gc, 
                                   ObjectHeader *obj) {
    TypeInfo *type = get_type_info(obj->header.bits.type_id);
    
    if (type->flags & TYPE_ARRAY) {
        if (type->element_type == TYPE_REFERENCE) {
            ArrayObject *arr = (ArrayObject*)obj;
            for (size_t i = 0; i < arr->header.aux.array_length; i++) {
                if (arr->elements[i].type == VALUE_OBJECT) {
                    arr->elements[i].obj = 
                        get_forwarding_address(gc->forwarding, 
                                             arr->elements[i].obj);
                }
            }
        }
    } else {
        // Update fixed object fields
        FixedObject *fixed = (FixedObject*)obj;
        for (size_t i = 0; i < type->field_count; i++) {
            if (type->fields[i].is_reference) {
                Value *field = &fixed->fields[i];
                if (field->type == VALUE_OBJECT && field->obj) {
                    field->obj = 
                        get_forwarding_address(gc->forwarding, field->obj);
                }
            }
        }
    }
}

13.6 Object Movement Phase

13.6.1 Compact Memory

static void compact_heap(CompactingCollector *gc, Heap *heap) {
    uint8_t *scan = heap->old_gen.start;
    
    while (scan < heap->old_gen.alloc_ptr) {
        ObjectHeader *obj = (ObjectHeader*)scan;
        size_t obj_size = object_size(obj);
        
        if (is_marked(gc->mark_bits, obj)) {
            void *new_addr = get_forwarding_address(gc->forwarding, obj);
            
            if (new_addr != obj) {
                // Move object
                memmove(new_addr, obj, obj_size);
                gc->stats.moved_objects++;
                gc->stats.moved_bytes += obj_size;
            }
        }
        
        scan += obj_size;
    }
    
    // Update heap allocation pointer
    heap->old_gen.alloc_ptr = gc->compact_pointer;
}

13.7 Optimizations

13.7.1 Threaded Compaction

For better performance on objects with many pointers:

static void threaded_compact(CompactingCollector *gc, Heap *heap) {
    // First pass: thread objects through their first field
    thread_objects(gc, heap);
    
    // Second pass: update pointers
    update_threaded_references(gc, heap);
    
    // Third pass: move objects
    move_threaded_objects(gc, heap);
}

static void thread_objects(CompactingCollector *gc, Heap *heap) {
    uint8_t *free = heap->old_gen.start;
    ObjectHeader *prev = NULL;
    
    for (uint8_t *scan = heap->old_gen.start; 
         scan < heap->old_gen.alloc_ptr;) {
        ObjectHeader *obj = (ObjectHeader*)scan;
        size_t size = object_size(obj);
        
        if (is_marked(gc->mark_bits, obj)) {
            if (prev) {
                // Thread through first field
                *(void**)prev = obj;
            }
            set_forwarding_address(gc->forwarding, obj, free);
            prev = obj;
            free += size;
        }
        
        scan += size;
    }
}

13.7.2 Sliding Compaction

For minimal auxiliary space:

static void sliding_compact(CompactingCollector *gc, Heap *heap) {
    // Compute break table
    BreakTable *breaks = compute_break_table(gc, heap);
    
    // Update references using break table
    update_with_breaks(gc, heap, breaks);
    
    // Slide objects
    slide_objects(gc, heap, breaks);
}

13.8 Large Object Handling

13.8.1 Non-Moving Large Objects

static bool should_move_large_object(LargeObject *obj, GCStats *stats) {
    // Don't move very large objects
    if (obj->size > LARGE_OBJECT_MOVE_THRESHOLD)
        return false;
        
    // Don't move if fragmentation is low
    if (stats->fragmentation_ratio < 0.1)
        return false;
        
    return true;
}

static void compact_large_objects(CompactingCollector *gc, Heap *heap) {
    LargeObject *current = heap->large_objects;
    
    while (current) {
        if (is_marked(gc->mark_bits, &current->header) &&
            should_move_large_object(current, &gc->stats)) {
            // Add to compaction set
            add_to_compaction_set(gc, current);
        }
        current = current->next;
    }
}

13.9 Concurrent Compaction Support

13.9.1 Read Barrier for Concurrent Compaction

static inline void* read_barrier(void *ref) {
    if (in_forwarding_phase() && is_forwarded(ref)) {
        return get_forwarding_pointer(ref);
    }
    return ref;
}

// Compiler inserts read barriers
#define LOAD_FIELD(obj, field) \
    read_barrier((obj)->field)

13.9.2 Incremental Compaction

static void incremental_compact_step(CompactingCollector *gc, 
                                   size_t work_units) {
    size_t units_done = 0;
    
    while (units_done < work_units && gc->current_block < gc->end_block) {
        CompactionBlock *block = &gc->blocks[gc->current_block];
        
        compact_block(gc, block);
        update_block_references(gc, block);
        
        units_done += block->size / WORK_UNIT_SIZE;
        gc->current_block++;
    }
}

13.10 Performance Analysis

13.10.1 Fragmentation Metrics

typedef struct FragmentationStats {
    size_t total_free_bytes;
    size_t largest_free_block;
    size_t free_block_count;
    double fragmentation_ratio;
} FragmentationStats;

static void measure_fragmentation(Heap *heap, FragmentationStats *stats) {
    stats->total_free_bytes = 0;
    stats->largest_free_block = 0;
    stats->free_block_count = 0;
    
    uint8_t *scan = heap->old_gen.start;
    while (scan < heap->old_gen.alloc_ptr) {
        ObjectHeader *obj = (ObjectHeader*)scan;
        size_t size = object_size(obj);
        
        if (!is_marked(gc->mark_bits, obj)) {
            stats->total_free_bytes += size;
            stats->free_block_count++;
            if (size > stats->largest_free_block) {
                stats->largest_free_block = size;
            }
        }
        
        scan += size;
    }
    
    stats->fragmentation_ratio = 1.0 - 
        ((double)stats->largest_free_block / stats->total_free_bytes);
}

13.11 Integration with VM

13.11.1 GC Triggers

static bool should_compact(VM *vm) {
    Heap *heap = vm->heap;
    
    // Compact if fragmentation exceeds threshold
    if (heap->fragmentation_ratio > FRAGMENTATION_THRESHOLD)
        return true;
        
    // Compact if allocation failures after mark-sweep
    if (heap->allocation_failures > ALLOCATION_FAILURE_THRESHOLD)
        return true;
        
    // Compact periodically
    if (heap->collections_since_compaction > COMPACTION_PERIOD)
        return true;
        
    return false;
}

13.11.2 Safe Points

void vm_gc_safepoint(VM *vm) {
    if (vm->gc_requested) {
        // Save registers
        save_thread_state(vm->current_coroutine);
        
        // Perform collection
        if (should_compact(vm)) {
            mark_and_compact(vm->gc, vm);
        } else {
            mark_and_sweep(vm->gc, vm);
        }
        
        // Resume execution
        restore_thread_state(vm->current_coroutine);
    }
}

13.12 Summary

This chapter presented Diyrbal's mark-and-compact collector, which provides:

  1. Fragmentation elimination through object movement
  2. Spatial locality improvement via compaction
  3. Multiple algorithms (two-finger, threaded, sliding)
  4. Large object special handling
  5. Incremental operation support
  6. Performance monitoring and adaptive triggers

The collector integrates seamlessly with the memory architecture from Chapter 12 and provides the foundation for efficient long-lived object management. Next, Chapter 14 will explore concurrent and parallel collection techniques that build upon this infrastructure. Based on the trace compilation concepts from your materials and building on previous chapters, here's Chapter 14 on Trace Detection and Recording:

Chapter 14: Trace Detection and Recording

14.1 Introduction

This chapter details Diyrbal's trace-based JIT compilation system, focusing on hot trace detection and efficient recording mechanisms. Building on the profiling infrastructure from earlier chapters, we implement a system that identifies frequently executed code paths and captures their runtime behavior for optimization.

14.2 Trace Architecture Overview

14.2.1 Core Components

typedef struct TraceSystem {
    // Detection
    HotspotDetector *detector;
    LoopTable *loop_headers;
    TraceCache *trace_cache;
    
    // Recording
    TraceRecorder *recorder;
    TraceBuffer *buffer;
    GuardTable *guards;
    
    // Statistics
    TraceStats stats;
    size_t max_trace_length;
    size_t max_recording_depth;
} TraceSystem;

typedef struct Trace {
    uint32_t id;
    void *entry_pc;
    void *compiled_code;
    
    // Trace structure
    TraceInstruction *instructions;
    size_t length;
    
    // Guards and assumptions
    GuardList *guards;
    TypeProfile *type_profile;
    
    // Execution statistics
    uint64_t execution_count;
    uint64_t exit_count[MAX_SIDE_EXITS];
} Trace;

14.3 Hotspot Detection

14.3.1 Loop Header Detection

Drawing from the efficient trace compilation concepts:

typedef struct LoopHeader {
    void *pc;
    uint32_t execution_count;
    uint32_t threshold;
    bool recording;
    struct LoopHeader *next;
} LoopHeader;

static void detect_loop_header(VM *vm, void *pc) {
    LoopHeader *header = lookup_loop_header(vm->trace_system->loop_headers, pc);
    
    if (!header) {
        // First backward branch to this location
        header = create_loop_header(pc);
        header->threshold = INITIAL_TRACE_THRESHOLD;
        insert_loop_header(vm->trace_system->loop_headers, header);
    }
    
    header->execution_count++;
    
    if (header->execution_count >= header->threshold && !header->recording) {
        // Start trace recording
        start_trace_recording(vm, pc);
        header->recording = true;
    }
}

14.3.2 Adaptive Thresholds

static void adjust_trace_threshold(LoopHeader *header, TraceExitReason reason) {
    switch (reason) {
    case EXIT_TRACE_COMPLETED:
        // Successful trace - lower threshold for related traces
        header->threshold = max(header->threshold / 2, MIN_THRESHOLD);
        break;
        
    case EXIT_TRACE_ABORTED:
        // Failed trace - increase threshold
        header->threshold = min(header->threshold * 2, MAX_THRESHOLD);
        break;
        
    case EXIT_NESTED_TRACE:
        // Nested trace detected - adjust moderately
        header->threshold = (header->threshold * 3) / 2;
        break;
    }
}

14.4 Trace Recording

14.4.1 Recording State

typedef struct TraceRecorder {
    // Recording state
    RecorderState state;
    void *anchor_pc;  // Loop header
    
    // Instruction buffer
    TraceInstruction *buffer;
    size_t buffer_size;
    size_t current_index;
    
    // Value tracking
    HashMap *value_map;  // SSA value -> recorded value
    uint32_t next_value_id;
    
    // Guard collection
    GuardList *guards;
    
    // Nested trace handling
    struct TraceRecorder *parent;
    int nesting_depth;
} TraceRecorder;

typedef enum {
    RECORDER_IDLE,
    RECORDER_RECORDING,
    RECORDER_ABORTED,
    RECORDER_COMPLETED
} RecorderState;

14.4.2 Instruction Recording

static void record_instruction(TraceRecorder *recorder, 
                              VMInstruction *inst,
                              ExecutionContext *ctx) {
    if (recorder->current_index >= recorder->buffer_size) {
        abort_recording(recorder, TRACE_TOO_LONG);
        return;
    }
    
    TraceInstruction *trace_inst = &recorder->buffer[recorder->current_index++];
    
    // Record instruction
    trace_inst->opcode = inst->opcode;
    trace_inst->pc = inst->pc;
    
    // Record operand values and types
    for (int i = 0; i < inst->num_operands; i++) {
        Value *val = &ctx->stack[ctx->sp - inst->num_operands + i];
        trace_inst->operands[i] = record_value(recorder, val);
        trace_inst->operand_types[i] = val->type;
    }
    
    // Add type guards if needed
    add_type_guards(recorder, trace_inst, ctx);
}

static TraceValue record_value(TraceRecorder *recorder, Value *val) {
    TraceValue tv;
    tv.id = recorder->next_value_id++;
    tv.type = val->type;
    
    if (val->type == VALUE_INT) {
        tv.constant = true;
        tv.int_value = val->int_value;
    } else if (val->type == VALUE_OBJECT) {
        tv.constant = false;
        tv.object_type = get_object_type(val->obj);
        // Record object shape for optimization
        tv.shape_id = get_object_shape(val->obj);
    }
    
    // Track value in SSA form
    hash_map_insert(recorder->value_map, val, tv);
    
    return tv;
}

14.5 Control Flow Recording

14.5.1 Branch Recording

static void record_branch(TraceRecorder *recorder, 
                         BranchInstruction *branch,
                         bool taken) {
    TraceInstruction *trace_inst = allocate_trace_instruction(recorder);
    
    if (taken && branch->target == recorder->anchor_pc) {
        // Loop closing branch
        complete_trace_recording(recorder);
        return;
    }
    
    // Record as guard
    Guard *guard = create_branch_guard(branch, taken);
    add_guard(recorder->guards, guard);
    
    // Record branch for trace
    trace_inst->opcode = taken ? OP_GUARD_TRUE : OP_GUARD_FALSE;
    trace_inst->guard_id = guard->id;
}

14.5.2 Call Recording

static void record_call(TraceRecorder *recorder,
                       CallInstruction *call,
                       Method *target) {
    // Check for recursive calls
    if (is_recursive_call(recorder, target)) {
        abort_recording(recorder, RECURSIVE_CALL);
        return;
    }
    
    // Decide on inlining
    if (should_inline_in_trace(target)) {
        // Record entry guard
        Guard *guard = create_method_guard(call->receiver_type, target);
        add_guard(recorder->guards, guard);
        
        // Continue recording into called method
        recorder->inline_depth++;
        record_inline_entry(recorder, target);
    } else {
        // Record as call
        record_trace_call(recorder, call, target);
    }
}

static bool should_inline_in_trace(Method *method) {
    return method->bytecode_size < TRACE_INLINE_THRESHOLD &&
           !method->has_loops &&
           method->is_leaf;
}

14.6 Guard Management

14.6.1 Guard Types

typedef enum {
    GUARD_TYPE,      // Type check
    GUARD_CLASS,     // Exact class check
    GUARD_SHAPE,     // Object shape/layout
    GUARD_OVERFLOW,  // Arithmetic overflow
    GUARD_BOUNDS,    // Array bounds
    GUARD_NULL,      // Null check
    GUARD_VALUE      // Constant value
} GuardType;

typedef struct Guard {
    uint32_t id;
    GuardType type;
    
    union {
        struct {
            uint32_t value_id;
            TypeID expected_type;
        } type_guard;
        
        struct {
            uint32_t value_id;
            int64_t expected_value;
        } value_guard;
        
        struct {
            uint32_t array_id;
            uint32_t index_id;
        } bounds_guard;
    } data;
    
    void *fallback_pc;  // Side exit target
    uint32_t failure_count;
} Guard;

14.6.2 Guard Optimization

static void optimize_guards(TraceRecorder *recorder) {
    // Remove redundant guards
    eliminate_redundant_guards(recorder->guards);
    
    // Hoist guards where beneficial
    hoist_loop_invariant_guards(recorder);
    
    // Strengthen guards based on profiling
    strengthen_guards_from_profile(recorder);
}

static void eliminate_redundant_guards(GuardList *guards) {
    HashMap *known_types = hash_map_create();
    
    for (Guard *g = guards->head; g; g = g->next) {
        if (g->type == GUARD_TYPE) {
            TypeID *known = hash_map_get(known_types, g->data.type_guard.value_id);
            if (known && *known == g->data.type_guard.expected_type) {
                // Guard is redundant
                mark_guard_eliminated(g);
            } else {
                hash_map_insert(known_types, 
                              g->data.type_guard.value_id,
                              g->data.type_guard.expected_type);
            }
        }
    }
}

14.7 Side Exit Handling

14.7.1 Side Exit Recording

typedef struct SideExit {
    uint32_t guard_id;
    void *native_pc;  // Location in compiled code
    void *bytecode_pc;  // Resume point
    
    // Deoptimization info
    FrameState *frame_state;
    ValueLocation *live_values;
    
    // Statistics
    uint64_t taken_count;
    bool compilation_triggered;
} SideExit;

static void record_side_exit(TraceRecorder *recorder, Guard *guard) {
    SideExit *exit = allocate_side_exit();
    
    exit->guard_id = guard->id;
    exit->bytecode_pc = guard->fallback_pc;
    
    // Capture frame state for deoptimization
    exit->frame_state = capture_frame_state(recorder);
    exit->live_values = capture_live_values(recorder);
    
    add_side_exit(recorder->current_trace, exit);
}

14.7.2 Exit Frequency Tracking

static void handle_side_exit(VM *vm, SideExit *exit) {
    exit->taken_count++;
    
    if (exit->taken_count > SIDE_EXIT_THRESHOLD && 
        !exit->compilation_triggered) {
        // Trigger trace extension or new trace
        trigger_trace_from_side_exit(vm, exit);
        exit->compilation_triggered = true;
    }
    
    // Deoptimize and resume interpretation
    deoptimize_from_exit(vm, exit);
}

14.8 Trace Completion

14.8.1 Trace Validation

static bool validate_recorded_trace(TraceRecorder *recorder) {
    Trace *trace = build_trace(recorder);
    
    // Check trace properties
    if (trace->length < MIN_TRACE_LENGTH) {
        return false;  // Too short
    }
    
    if (trace->length > MAX_TRACE_LENGTH) {
        return false;  // Too long
    }
    
    // Verify trace forms a loop
    if (!forms_loop(trace)) {
        return false;
    }
    
    // Check guard complexity
    if (count_guards(trace) > MAX_GUARDS_PER_TRACE) {
        return false;  // Too many guards
    }
    
    return true;
}

14.8.2 Trace Finalization

static Trace* finalize_trace(TraceRecorder *recorder) {
    Trace *trace = allocate_trace();
    
    trace->id = next_trace_id();
    trace->entry_pc = recorder->anchor_pc;
    trace->length = recorder->current_index;
    
    // Copy recorded instructions
    trace->instructions = copy_trace_buffer(recorder->buffer, 
                                           recorder->current_index);
    
    // Optimize guards
    optimize_guards(recorder);
    trace->guards = recorder->guards;
    
    // Build type profile
    trace->type_profile = build_type_profile(recorder);
    
    // Register trace
    register_trace(vm->trace_system->trace_cache, trace);
    
    return trace;
}

14.9 Trace Cache Management

14.9.1 Trace Cache Structure

typedef struct TraceCache {
    HashMap *pc_to_trace;  // PC -> Trace mapping
    Trace **traces;        // All traces
    size_t trace_count;
    size_t max_traces;
    
    // Eviction policy
    EvictionPolicy policy;
    size_t total_size;
    size_t max_size;
} TraceCache;

static void manage_trace_cache(TraceCache *cache) {
    if (cache->total_size > cache->max_size) {
        // Evict cold traces
        evict_cold_traces(cache);
    }
    
    if (cache->trace_count > cache->max_traces) {
        // Evict least recently used
        evict_lru_traces(cache);
    }
}

14.10 Nested and Linked Traces

14.10.1 Nested Trace Detection

static void handle_nested_loop(TraceRecorder *recorder, void *inner_pc) {
    if (recorder->nesting_depth >= MAX_NESTING_DEPTH) {
        abort_recording(recorder, NESTING_TOO_DEEP);
        return;
    }
    
    // Check if inner loop has a trace
    Trace *inner_trace = lookup_trace(vm->trace_system->trace_cache, inner_pc);
    
    if (inner_trace) {
        // Link to existing trace
        record_trace_call_instruction(recorder, inner_trace);
    } else {
        // Continue recording through inner loop
        recorder->nesting_depth++;
        mark_nested_region(recorder, inner_pc);
    }
}

14.10.2 Trace Linking

typedef struct TraceLink {
    Trace *from_trace;
    Trace *to_trace;
    SideExit *exit_point;
    uint64_t transition_count;
} TraceLink;

static void link_traces(VM *vm, Trace *from, SideExit *exit) {
    void *target_pc = exit->bytecode_pc;
    Trace *to = lookup_trace(vm->trace_system->trace_cache, target_pc);
    
    if (to && is_compatible_trace_transition(from, to, exit)) {
        // Create direct link
        patch_exit_to_trace(exit, to);
        
        // Track link for profiling
        record_trace_link(from, to, exit);
    }
}

14.11 Performance Monitoring

14.11.1 Trace Statistics

typedef struct TraceStats {
    // Recording statistics
    uint64_t traces_recorded;
# Chapter 15: Trace Optimization and Peephole Optimization

## 15.1 Introduction

This chapter details Diyrbal's trace optimization pipeline, focusing on specialized optimizations for linear trace code and efficient peephole optimization patterns. Building on the recorded traces from Chapter 14, we implement both high-level trace optimizations and low-level peephole transformations.

## 15.2 Trace Optimization Architecture

### 15.2.1 Optimization Pipeline
```c
typedef struct TraceOptimizer {
    // Optimization passes
    OptimizationPass *passes;
    size_t num_passes;
    
    // Analysis data
    TraceDataflow *dataflow;
    AliasAnalysis *alias_info;
    TypeLattice *type_info;
    
    // Peephole patterns
    PeepholePatternDB *patterns;
    
    // Statistics
    OptimizationStats stats;
} TraceOptimizer;

typedef struct OptimizationPass {
    const char *name;
    bool (*optimize)(Trace *trace, TraceDataflow *df);
    PassFlags flags;
    size_t iterations;
} OptimizationPass;

15.2.2 Trace IR Extensions

typedef struct TraceInstruction {
    Opcode opcode;
    uint32_t dest;
    uint32_t operands[MAX_OPERANDS];
    
    // Trace-specific metadata
    GuardInfo *guard;
    ProfileData *profile;
    
    // Optimization annotations
    uint32_t flags;
    void *optimization_data;
} TraceInstruction;

typedef enum {
    INST_DEAD = 1 << 0,
    INST_INVARIANT = 1 << 1,
    INST_REDUNDANT = 1 << 2,
    INST_GUARD_ELIMINATED = 1 << 3,
    INST_PEEPHOLE_MATCHED = 1 << 4
} InstructionFlags;

15.3 Guard Optimization

15.3.1 Guard Elimination

static bool eliminate_redundant_guards(Trace *trace, TraceDataflow *df) {
    bool changed = false;
    GuardState *state = create_guard_state();
    
    for (size_t i = 0; i < trace->length; i++) {
        TraceInstruction *inst = &trace->instructions[i];
        
        if (is_guard_instruction(inst)) {
            if (is_guard_redundant(inst, state)) {
                // Convert to no-op
                inst->opcode = OP_NOP;
                inst->flags |= INST_GUARD_ELIMINATED;
                changed = true;
                trace->stats.guards_eliminated++;
            } else {
                // Update state
                update_guard_state(state, inst);
            }
        } else {
            // Update state based on instruction effects
            apply_instruction_effects(state, inst);
        }
    }
    
    return changed;
}

static bool is_guard_redundant(TraceInstruction *guard, GuardState *state) {
    switch (guard->opcode) {
    case OP_GUARD_TYPE:
        return state->known_types[guard->operands[0]] == 
               guard->guard->expected_type;
        
    case OP_GUARD_BOUNDS:
        return is_bounds_check_redundant(guard, state);
        
    case OP_GUARD_NULL:
        return state->non_null_values[guard->operands[0]];
        
    default:
        return false;
    }
}

15.3.2 Guard Strengthening

static void strengthen_guards(Trace *trace) {
    for (size_t i = 0; i < trace->length; i++) {
        TraceInstruction *inst = &trace->instructions[i];
        
        if (is_type_guard(inst) && inst->profile) {
            TypeProfile *prof = inst->profile->type_profile;
            
            if (prof->monomorphic_ratio > MONOMORPHIC_THRESHOLD) {
                // Strengthen to exact type check
                strengthen_to_class_guard(inst, prof->dominant_type);
            }
        }
    }
}

15.4 Allocation Sinking

15.4.1 Escape Analysis

typedef struct EscapeInfo {
    BitVector *escaping_values;
    HashMap *allocation_sites;
    BitVector *scalar_replaceable;
} EscapeInfo;

static EscapeInfo* analyze_escapes(Trace *trace) {
    EscapeInfo *info = create_escape_info(trace);
    
    // Find allocations
    for (size_t i = 0; i < trace->length; i++) {
        TraceInstruction *inst = &trace->instructions[i];
        
        if (is_allocation(inst)) {
            mark_allocation(info, i, inst->dest);
        }
    }
    
    // Analyze uses
    for (size_t i = 0; i < trace->length; i++) {
        TraceInstruction *inst = &trace->instructions[i];
        
        for (int j = 0; j < get_operand_count(inst); j++) {
            uint32_t operand = inst->operands[j];
            
            if (is_allocation_result(info, operand)) {
                if (causes_escape(inst, j)) {
                    mark_escaping(info, operand);
                }
            }
        }
    }
    
    return info;
}

15.4.2 Allocation Sinking Transformation

static bool sink_allocations(Trace *trace, EscapeInfo *escape_info) {
    bool changed = false;
    
    for (size_t i = 0; i < trace->length; i++) {
        TraceInstruction *inst = &trace->instructions[i];
        
        if (is_allocation(inst) && 
            !is_escaping(escape_info, inst->dest)) {
            // Move allocation to side exits
            changed |= sink_allocation_to_exits(trace, i, inst);
        }
    }
    
    return changed;
}

static bool sink_allocation_to_exits(Trace *trace, size_t alloc_idx, 
                                    TraceInstruction *alloc) {
    // Find all side exits
    for (SideExit *exit = trace->side_exits; exit; exit = exit->next) {
        if (is_value_live_at_exit(alloc->dest, exit)) {
            // Add allocation to exit's deoptimization info
            add_deferred_allocation(exit, alloc);
        }
    }
    
    // Remove from trace
    alloc->opcode = OP_NOP;
    alloc->flags |= INST_DEAD;
    
    return true;
}

15.5 Loop-Invariant Code Motion (LICM)

15.5.1 Invariant Detection

static BitVector* find_loop_invariants(Trace *trace) {
    BitVector *invariant = bit_vector_create(trace->length);
    bool changed = true;
    
    // Initialize with potentially invariant instructions
    for (size_t i = 0; i < trace->length; i++) {
        TraceInstruction *inst = &trace->instructions[i];
        
        if (!has_side_effects(inst) && !is_guard(inst)) {
            bit_vector_set(invariant, i);
        }
    }
    
    // Fixed-point iteration
    while (changed) {
        changed = false;
        
        for (size_t i = 0; i < trace->length; i++) {
            if (!bit_vector_get(invariant, i)) continue;
            
            TraceInstruction *inst = &trace->instructions[i];
            
            // Check if operands are invariant
            for (int j = 0; j < get_operand_count(inst); j++) {
                uint32_t operand = inst->operands[j];
                size_t def_idx = find_definition(trace, operand);
                
                if (def_idx < trace->length && 
                    !bit_vector_get(invariant, def_idx)) {
                    bit_vector_clear(invariant, i);
                    changed = true;
                    break;
                }
            }
        }
    }
    
    return invariant;
}

15.5.2 Code Motion

static bool hoist_invariants(Trace *trace, BitVector *invariants) {
    bool changed = false;
    TraceInstruction *preheader = create_preheader(trace);
    
    for (size_t i = 0; i < trace->length; i++) {
        if (!bit_vector_get(invariants, i)) continue;
        
        TraceInstruction *inst = &trace->instructions[i];
        
        // Check if safe to hoist
        if (can_hoist_instruction(inst, trace)) {
            // Move to preheader
            copy_instruction(preheader, inst);
            inst->opcode = OP_NOP;
            inst->flags |= INST_DEAD;
            changed = true;
        }
    }
    
    return changed;
}

15.6 Peephole Optimization

15.6.1 Pattern Database

typedef struct PeepholePattern {
    const char *name;
    size_t length;
    PatternMatcher matcher;
    PatternTransformer transformer;
    uint32_t benefit;  // Estimated cycles saved
} PeepholePattern;

typedef bool (*PatternMatcher)(TraceInstruction *window, size_t len);
typedef void (*PatternTransformer)(TraceInstruction *window, size_t len);

static PeepholePattern patterns[] = {
    // Algebraic simplifications
    {
        .name = "add_zero_elimination",
        .length = 1,
        .matcher = match_add_zero,
        .transformer = eliminate_add_zero,
        .benefit = 1
    },
    
    // Strength reduction
    {
        .name = "multiply_by_power_of_two",
        .length = 1,
        .matcher = match_mul_power_of_two,
        .transformer = transform_mul_to_shift,
        .benefit = 3
    },
    
    // Load/store optimizations
    {
        .name = "redundant_load_elimination",
        .length = 2,
        .matcher = match_redundant_load,
        .transformer = eliminate_redundant_load,
        .benefit = 4
    },
    
    // Guard combinations
    {
        .name = "combine_type_guards",
        .length = 2,
        .matcher = match_compatible_guards,
        .transformer = combine_guards,
        .benefit = 5
    }
};

15.6.2 Pattern Matching Engine

static bool apply_peephole_optimizations(Trace *trace) {
    bool changed = false;
    size_t window_max = 4;  // Maximum pattern length
    
    for (size_t i = 0; i < trace->length; i++) {
        // Skip dead instructions
        if (trace->instructions[i].flags & INST_DEAD) continue;
        
        // Try each pattern
        for (size_t p = 0; p < ARRAY_SIZE(patterns); p++) {
            PeepholePattern *pattern = &patterns[p];
            
            if (i + pattern->length <= trace->length) {
                TraceInstruction *window = &trace->instructions[i];
                
                if (pattern->matcher(window, pattern->length)) {
                    pattern->transformer(window, pattern->length);
                    trace->stats.peephole_matches++;
                    changed = true;
                    
                    // Mark as transformed
                    for (size_t j = 0; j < pattern->length; j++) {
                        window[j].flags |= INST_PEEPHOLE_MATCHED;
                    }
                    
                    break;  // Try next position
                }
            }
        }
    }
    
    return changed;
}

15.6.3 Common Peephole Patterns

// Pattern: x + 0 -> x
static bool match_add_zero(TraceInstruction *window, size_t len) {
    return window[0].opcode == OP_ADD &&
           is_constant(window, window[0].operands[1]) &&
           get_constant_value(window, window[0].operands[1]) == 0;
}

static void eliminate_add_zero(TraceInstruction *window, size_t len) {
    window[0].opcode = OP_MOVE;
    window[0].operands[1] = UNUSED_OPERAND;
}

// Pattern: x * 2^n -> x << n
static bool match_mul_power_of_two(TraceInstruction *window, size_t len) {
    if (window[0].opcode != OP_MUL) return false;
    
    int64_t value = get_constant_value(window, window[0].operands[1]);
    return is_power_of_two(value);
}

static void transform_mul_to_shift(TraceInstruction *window, size_t len) {
    int64_t value = get_constant_value(window, window[0].operands[1]);
    int shift = count_trailing_zeros(value);
    
    window[0].opcode = OP_SHL;
    set_constant_value(window, window[0].operands[1], shift);
}

// Pattern: store x; load x -> store x; move x
static bool match_redundant_load(TraceInstruction *window, size_t len) {
    return window[0].opcode == OP_STORE &&
           window[1].opcode == OP_LOAD &&
           same_memory_location(window[0], window[1]) &&
           !may_alias(window[0], window[1]);
}

static void eliminate_redundant_load(TraceInstruction *window, size_t len) {
    window[1].opcode = OP_MOVE;
    window[1].operands[0] = window[0].operands[0];  // Value that was stored
}

15.7 Instruction Combining

15.7.1 Arithmetic Combining

static bool combine_arithmetic(Trace *trace) {
    bool changed = false;
    
    for (size_t i = 0; i < trace->length - 1; i++) {
        TraceInstruction *inst1 = &trace->instructions[i];
        TraceInstruction *inst2 = &trace->instructions[i + 1];
        
        // Pattern: (x + a) + b -> x + (a + b)
        if (inst1->opcode == OP_ADD && inst2->opcode == OP_ADD &&
            inst2->operands[0] == inst1->dest &&
            is_constant(trace, inst1->operands[1]) &&
            is_constant(trace, inst2->operands[1])) {
            
            int64_t a = get_constant_value(trace, inst1->operands[1]);
            int64_t b = get_constant_value(trace, inst2->operands[1]);
            
            // Combine into single add
            inst2->operands[0] = inst1->operands[0];
            set_constant_value(trace, inst2->operands[1], a + b);
            
            // Eliminate first instruction
            inst1->opcode = OP_NOP;
            inst1->flags |= INST_DEAD;
            
            changed = true;
        }
    }
    
    return changed;
}

15.7.2 Memory Operation Combining

static bool combine_memory_operations(Trace *trace) {
    bool changed = false;
    
    for (size_t i = 0; i < trace->length - 1; i++) {
        TraceInstruction *inst1 = &trace->instructions[i];
        TraceInstruction *inst2 = &trace->instructions[i + 1];
        
        // Pattern: narrow loads/stores to wider operations
        if (are_adjacent_memory_ops(inst1, inst2)) {
            if (can_combine_to_wider_op(inst1, inst2)) {
                combine_memory_ops(inst1, inst2);
                changed = true;
            }
        }
    }
    
    return changed;
}

15.8 Trace-Specific Optimizations

15.8.1 Guard Motion

static bool optimize_guard_placement(Trace *trace) {
    bool changed = false;
    
    // Move guards as early as possible
    for (size_t i = trace->length - 1; i > 0; i--) {
        TraceInstruction *guard = &trace->instructions[i];
        
        if (!is_guard_instruction(guard)) continue;
        
        // Find earliest safe position
        size_t earliest = find_earliest_position(trace, guard, i);
        
        if (earliest < i) {
            move_instruction(trace, i, earliest);
            changed = true;
        }
    }
    
    return changed;
}

15.8.2 Exit Stub Optimization

static void optimize_side_exits(Trace *trace) {
    for (SideExit *exit = trace->side_exits; exit; exit = exit->next) {
        // Minimize live state at exits
        minimize_exit_state(trace, exit);
        
        // Create specialized exit stubs for hot exits
        if (exit->taken_count > HOT_EXIT_THRESHOLD) {
            create_specialized_exit_stub(trace, exit);
        }
    }
}

15.9 Optimization Driver

15.9.1 Pass Management

static OptimizationPass optimization_passes[] = {
    // Early optimizations
    { "guard_elimination", eliminate_redundant_guards, PASS_REPEAT, 0 },
    { "dead_code_elimination", eliminate_dead_code, PASS_REPEAT, 0 },
    
    // Mid-level optimizations
    { "licm", hoist_invariants, PASS_ONCE, 0 },
    { "allocation_sinking", sink_allocations, PASS_ONCE, 0 },
    
    // Late optimizations
    { "peephole", apply_peephole_optimizations, PASS_REPEAT, 0 },
    { "instruction_combining", combine_instructions, PASS_REPEAT, 0 },
    
    // Final cleanup
    { "final_dce", eliminate_dead_code, PASS_ONCE, 0 }
};

static void optimize_trace(Trace *trace) {
    TraceOptimizer *optimizer = create_trace_optimizer();
    
    // Run optimization passes
    bool changed = true;
    int iteration = 0;
    
    while (changed && iteration < MAX_OPT_ITERATIONS) {
        changed = false;
        
        for (size_t i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(optimization_passes); i++) {
            OptimizationPass *pass = &optimization_passes[i];
            
            if (pass->flags & PASS_REPEAT || pass->iterations == 0) {
                bool pass_changed = pass->optimize(trace, optimizer->dataflow);
                changed |= pass_changed;
                pass->iterations++;
                
                if (pass_changed) {
                    update_dataflow_info(optimizer->dataflow, trace);
                }
            }
        }
        
        iteration++;
    }
    
    // Final verification
    verify_trace_consistency(trace);
}

15.10 Performance Monitoring

15.10.1 Optimization Statistics

typedef struct OptimizationStats {
    // Guard optimizations
    uint64_t guards_eliminated;
    uint64_t guards_strengthened;
    uint64_t guards_combined;
    
    // Code motion
    uint64_t invariants_hoisted;
    uint64_t allocations_sunk;
    
    // Peephole
    uint64_t peephole_matches;
    uint64_t instructions_combined;
    
    // Overall impact
    uint64_t instructions_before;
    uint64_t instructions_after;
    uint64_t estimated_cycles_saved;
} OptimizationStats;

static void report_optimization_stats(Trace *trace) {
    OptimizationStats *stats = &trace->optimizer->stats;
    
    double reduction = 100.0 * (stats->instructions_before - 
                               stats->instructions_after) / 
                               stats->instructions_before;
    
    trace_log("Trace %u optimization: %zu -> %zu instructions (%.1f%% reduction)",
              trace->id,
              stats->instructions_before,
              stats->instructions_after,
              reduction);
}

This chapter sets up the foundation for Chapter 16, which will cover the native code generation from these optimized traces.

Chapter 16: Native Code Generation

16.1 Introduction

This chapter details Diyrbal's native code generation system, transforming optimized traces into efficient machine code. We implement multi-architecture support with sophisticated register allocation, instruction selection, and target-specific optimizations.

16.2 Code Generation Architecture

16.2.1 Core Components

typedef struct CodeGenerator {
    // Target architecture
    TargetArch arch;
    TargetInfo *target_info;
    
    // Code emission
    CodeBuffer *code_buffer;
    uint8_t *code_ptr;
    size_t code_size;
    
    // Register allocation
    RegisterAllocator *reg_alloc;
    RegisterFile *reg_file;
    
    // Instruction selection
    InstructionSelector *selector;
    PatternMatcher *matcher;
    
    // Relocations and patching
    RelocationList *relocations;
    PatchPointList *patch_points;
    
    // Debug info
    DebugInfoBuilder *debug_info;
} CodeGenerator;

typedef enum {
    ARCH_X86_64,
    ARCH_AARCH64,
    ARCH_RISCV64
} TargetArch;

16.2.2 Code Buffer Management

typedef struct CodeBuffer {
    uint8_t *buffer;
    size_t capacity;
    size_t position;
    
    // Sections
    size_t prologue_offset;
    size_t body_offset;
    size_t epilogue_offset;
    size_t stub_offset;
    
    // Alignment tracking
    size_t alignment;
    uint8_t nop_fill[16];
} CodeBuffer;

static void emit_bytes(CodeBuffer *buf, const uint8_t *bytes, size_t len) {
    ensure_capacity(buf, len);
    memcpy(buf->buffer + buf->position, bytes, len);
    buf->position += len;
}

static void align_code(CodeBuffer *buf, size_t alignment) {
    size_t current = buf->position;
    size_t aligned = ALIGN_UP(current, alignment);
    size_t padding = aligned - current;
    
    if (padding > 0) {
        emit_nop_sequence(buf, padding);
    }
}

16.3 Register Allocation

16.3.1 Linear Scan Allocator

typedef struct LiveInterval {
    uint32_t vreg;      // Virtual register
    size_t start;       // Start position
    size_t end;         // End position
    
    // Physical register assignment
    Register assigned;
    bool spilled;
    int32_t spill_slot;
    
    // Use positions for splitting
    UsePositionList *use_positions;
    struct LiveInterval *next;
} LiveInterval;

static void allocate_registers(CodeGenerator *gen, Trace *trace) {
    // Build live intervals
    LiveInterval *intervals = build_live_intervals(trace);
    
    // Sort by start position
    sort_intervals_by_start(intervals);
    
    // Linear scan allocation
    RegisterSet available = gen->reg_file->allocatable;
    LiveInterval *active = NULL;
    
    for (LiveInterval *current = intervals; current; current = current->next) {
        // Expire old intervals
        expire_old_intervals(&active, current->start, &available);
        
        if (has_available_register(available)) {
            // Allocate register
            Register reg = allocate_register(&available, current);
            current->assigned = reg;
            add_to_active(&active, current);
        } else {
            // Spill
            spill_at_interval(gen, current, active);
        }
    }
}

16.3.2 Spilling and Reloading

typedef struct SpillSlot {
    int32_t offset;     // Offset from frame pointer
    size_t size;        // Slot size
    ValueType type;     // Type of spilled value
} SpillSlot;

static void spill_at_interval(CodeGenerator *gen, 
                              LiveInterval *current,
                              LiveInterval *active) {
    // Find best candidate to spill
    LiveInterval *spill = find_spill_candidate(active, current);
    
    if (spill->end > current->end) {
        // Spill the other interval
        current->assigned = spill->assigned;
        spill->assigned = REG_NONE;
        spill->spilled = true;
        spill->spill_slot = allocate_spill_slot(gen, spill);
        
        remove_from_active(&active, spill);
        add_to_active(&active, current);
        
        // Insert spill/reload code
        insert_spill_code(gen, spill);
    } else {
        // Spill current
        current->spilled = true;
        current->spill_slot = allocate_spill_slot(gen, current);
    }
}

16.3.3 Register Classes

typedef struct RegisterClass {
    const char *name;
    RegisterSet members;
    size_t size;           // Register size in bytes
    RegisterType type;     // GPR, FPR, SIMD
} RegisterClass;

// x86-64 register classes
static RegisterClass x64_reg_classes[] = {
    {
        .name = "gpr64",
        .members = GPR64_MASK,
        .size = 8,
        .type = REG_TYPE_GPR
    },
    {
        .name = "xmm",
        .members = XMM_MASK,
        .size = 16,
        .type = REG_TYPE_SIMD
    }
};

// AArch64 register classes
static RegisterClass aarch64_reg_classes[] = {
    {
        .name = "x_regs",
        .members = X_REG_MASK,
        .size = 8,
        .type = REG_TYPE_GPR
    },
    {
        .name = "v_regs",
        .members = V_REG_MASK,
        .size = 16,
        .type = REG_TYPE_SIMD
    }
};

16.4 Instruction Selection

16.4.1 Pattern-Based Selection

typedef struct InstructionPattern {
    TraceOpcode trace_op;
    TargetInstruction target_inst;
    CostModel cost;
    PatternPredicate predicate;
} InstructionPattern;

// x86-64 patterns
static InstructionPattern x64_patterns[] = {
    // Simple arithmetic
    { OP_ADD, X64_ADD, { .latency = 1, .size = 3 }, NULL },
    { OP_SUB, X64_SUB, { .latency = 1, .size = 3 }, NULL },
    
    // Optimized patterns
    { OP_ADD, X64_LEA, { .latency = 1, .size = 3 }, is_lea_candidate },
    { OP_MUL, X64_IMUL, { .latency = 3, .size = 3 }, NULL },
    
    // Memory operations
    { OP_LOAD, X64_MOV, { .latency = 4, .size = 3 }, NULL },
    { OP_STORE, X64_MOV, { .latency = 1, .size = 3 }, NULL }
};

static void select_instructions(CodeGenerator *gen, Trace *trace) {
    for (size_t i = 0; i < trace->length; i++) {
        TraceInstruction *inst = &trace->instructions[i];
        
        // Find matching patterns
        InstructionPattern *best = find_best_pattern(gen, inst);
        
        if (best) {
            emit_target_instruction(gen, best, inst);
        } else {
            // Fallback to generic emission
            emit_generic_instruction(gen, inst);
        }
    }
}

16.4.2 Complex Pattern Matching

static bool match_address_computation(CodeGenerator *gen,
                                     TraceInstruction *inst,
                                     AddressMode *mode) {
    // Pattern: base + index * scale + displacement
    if (inst->opcode == OP_ADD) {
        TraceInstruction *left = get_definition(inst->operands[0]);
        TraceInstruction *right = get_definition(inst->operands[1]);
        
        if (left && left->opcode == OP_MUL) {
            // Found index * scale
            mode->base = inst->operands[1];
            mode->index = left->operands[0];
            mode->scale = get_constant_value(left->operands[1]);
            return is_valid_scale(mode->scale);
        }
    }
    
    return false;
}

16.5 Target-Specific Code Emission

16.5.1 x86-64 Code Generation

// x86-64 specific emitters
static void emit_x64_add(CodeGenerator *gen, 
                         Register dest, 
                         Register src1, 
                         Register src2) {
    uint8_t rex = compute_rex(dest, src1, src2);
    
    if (rex) emit_byte(gen, rex);
    emit_byte(gen, 0x01);  // ADD r/m64, r64
    emit_modrm(gen, dest, src2);
}

static void emit_x64_load(CodeGenerator *gen,
                         Register dest,
                         Register base,
                         int32_t offset) {
    uint8_t rex = REX_W | rex_r(dest) | rex_b(base);
    
    emit_byte(gen, rex);
    emit_byte(gen, 0x8B);  // MOV r64, m64
    
    if (offset == 0 && base != RBP) {
        emit_modrm(gen, dest, base);
    } else if (fits_in_byte(offset)) {
        emit_modrm_sib(gen, MOD_DISP8, dest, base);
        emit_byte(gen, offset);
    } else {
        emit_modrm_sib(gen, MOD_DISP32, dest, base);
        emit_int32(gen, offset);
    }
}

// Optimized instruction sequences
static void emit_x64_lea_complex(CodeGenerator *gen,
                                 Register dest,
                                 AddressMode *addr) {
    uint8_t rex = REX_W | rex_r(dest);
    
    if (addr->index != REG_NONE) {
        rex |= rex_x(addr->index);
    }
    if (addr->base != REG_NONE) {
        rex |= rex_b(addr->base);
    }
    
    emit_byte(gen, rex);
    emit_byte(gen, 0x8D);  // LEA r64, m
    
    // Emit complex addressing mode
    emit_sib(gen, addr->scale, addr->index, addr->base);
    
    if (addr->displacement != 0) {
        emit_int32(gen, addr->displacement);
    }
}

16.5.2 AArch64 Code Generation

// AArch64 specific emitters
static void emit_arm64_add(CodeGenerator *gen,
                           Register dest,
                           Register src1,
                           Register src2) {
    uint32_t inst = 0x8B000000;  // ADD X<d>, X<n>, X<m>
    inst |= (dest & 0x1F);
    inst |= ((src1 & 0x1F) << 5);
    inst |= ((src2 & 0x1F) << 16);
    
    emit_word(gen, inst);
}

static void emit_arm64_load(CodeGenerator *gen,
                            Register dest,
                            Register base,
                            int32_t offset) {
    if (offset >= -256 && offset <= 255) {
        // Unscaled immediate
        uint32_t inst = 0xF8400000;  // LDUR X<t>, [X<n>, #imm]
        inst |= (dest & 0x1F);
        inst |= ((base & 0x1F) << 5);
        inst |= ((offset & 0x1FF) << 12);
        emit_word(gen, inst);
    } else {
        // Load with register offset
        emit_arm64_add_immediate(gen, ARM64_TEMP_REG, base, offset);
        emit_arm64_load_indirect(gen, dest, ARM64_TEMP_REG);
    }
}

// Optimized sequences for AArch64
static void emit_arm64_madd(CodeGenerator *gen,
                            Register dest,
                            Register src1,
                            Register src2,
                            Register addend) {
    // MADD: dest = src1 * src2 + addend
    uint32_t inst = 0x9B000000;
    inst |= (dest & 0x1F);
    inst |= ((src1 & 0x1F) << 5);
    inst |= ((addend & 0x1F) << 10);
    inst |= ((src2 & 0x1F) << 16);
    
    emit_word(gen, inst);
}

16.6 Guard and Side Exit Generation

16.6.1 Guard Code Generation

static void emit_guard(CodeGenerator *gen, Guard *guard, SideExit *exit) {
    switch (guard->type) {
    case GUARD_TYPE:
        emit_type_guard(gen, guard, exit);
        break;
        
    case GUARD_BOUNDS:
        emit_bounds_guard(gen, guard, exit);
        break;
        
    case GUARD_OVERFLOW:
        emit_overflow_guard(gen, guard, exit);
        break;
    }
}

static void emit_type_guard(CodeGenerator *gen, Guard *guard, SideExit *exit) {
    Register obj_reg = get_register(gen, guard->data.type_guard.value_id);
    
    if (gen->arch == ARCH_X86_64) {
        // Load type field
        emit_x64_load(gen, TEMP_REG, obj_reg, OBJECT_TYPE_OFFSET);
        
        // Compare with expected type
        emit_x64_cmp_immediate(gen, TEMP_REG, guard->data.type_guard.expected_type);
        
        // Conditional jump to side exit
        emit_x64_jne(gen, 0);  // Placeholder
        add_patch_point(gen, PATCH_GUARD_EXIT, exit);
    } else if (gen->arch == ARCH_AARCH64) {
        // Similar for ARM64
        emit_arm64_load(gen, ARM64_TEMP_REG, obj_reg, OBJECT_TYPE_OFFSET);
        emit_arm64_cmp_immediate(gen, ARM64_TEMP_REG, 
                                guard->data.type_guard.expected_type);
        emit_arm64_bne(gen, 0);  // Placeholder
        add_patch_point(gen, PATCH_GUARD_EXIT, exit);
    }
}

16.6.2 Side Exit Stubs

static void generate_side_exit_stub(CodeGenerator *gen, SideExit *exit) {
    exit->stub_offset = gen->code_buffer->position;
    
    // Save live registers
    emit_save_live_registers(gen, exit->live_values);
    
    // Prepare deoptimization frame
    emit_prepare_deopt_frame(gen, exit->frame_state);
    
    // Call deoptimization handler
    if (gen->arch == ARCH_X86_64) {
        // Load exit ID
        emit_x64_mov_immediate(gen, RDI, exit->id);
        
        //
# Chapter 17: Profiling and Instrumentation

## 17.1 Introduction

This chapter covers Diyrbal's comprehensive profiling and instrumentation framework. We implement low-overhead profiling for hot spot detection, type feedback collection, and performance monitoring, along with a flexible instrumentation API for debugging and analysis.

## 17.2 Profiling Architecture

### 17.2.1 Core Components
```c
typedef struct Profiler {
    // Profile data storage
    ProfileDatabase *database;
    TypeProfileTable *type_profiles;
    EdgeProfileTable *edge_profiles;
    
    // Sampling infrastructure
    SampleBuffer *sample_buffer;
    size_t sample_interval;
    uint64_t sample_count;
    
    // Hot spot tracking
    HotMethodTable *hot_methods;
    HotLoopTable *hot_loops;
    
    // Instrumentation
    InstrumentationEngine *instr_engine;
    CallbackRegistry *callbacks;
    
    // Configuration
    ProfileConfig config;
    bool enabled;
} Profiler;

typedef struct ProfileDatabase {
    // Method profiles
    MethodProfile **method_profiles;
    size_t method_count;
    
    // Call site profiles  
    CallSiteProfile **call_profiles;
    size_t call_count;
    
    // Memory management
    ProfileArena *arena;
    SpinLock lock;
} ProfileDatabase;

17.2.2 Profile Data Structures

typedef struct MethodProfile {
    MethodID method_id;
    uint64_t invocation_count;
    uint64_t total_cycles;
    uint64_t self_cycles;
    
    // Basic block execution counts
    uint64_t *bb_counters;
    size_t bb_count;
    
    // Call site information
    CallSiteProfile *call_sites;
    size_t call_site_count;
    
    // Type feedback
    TypeProfile *type_feedback;
    
    // Deoptimization history
    DeoptRecord *deopt_history;
    uint32_t deopt_count;
} MethodProfile;

typedef struct TypeProfile {
    // Receiver type distribution
    TypeDistribution receiver_types;
    
    // Parameter type distributions
    TypeDistribution *param_types;
    size_t param_count;
    
    // Return type distribution
    TypeDistribution return_types;
    
    // Inline cache misses
    uint64_t ic_misses;
    uint64_t polymorphic_calls;
} TypeProfile;

17.3 Lightweight Profiling

17.3.1 Interpreter Profiling

// Bytecode dispatch with profiling
#define DISPATCH_PROFILED() do { \
    if (UNLIKELY(vm->profiler.enabled)) { \
        update_bytecode_profile(frame, pc); \
    } \
    goto *dispatch_table[*pc]; \
} while(0)

static void update_bytecode_profile(Frame *frame, uint8_t *pc) {
    MethodProfile *profile = get_method_profile(frame->method);
    
    // Increment bytecode counter
    size_t offset = pc - frame->method->bytecode;
    atomic_increment(&profile->bc_counters[offset]);
    
    // Sample type information periodically
    if ((profile->bc_counters[offset] & SAMPLE_MASK) == 0) {
        collect_type_sample(profile, frame, pc);
    }
}

// Optimized interpreter loop with minimal overhead
case OP_CALL: {
    Value callee = POP();
    int arg_count = READ_BYTE();
    
    if (LIKELY(!vm->profiler.enabled)) {
        // Fast path - no profiling
        call_value(callee, arg_count);
    } else {
        // Profiling path
        profile_call_site(frame, pc, callee);
        call_value(callee, arg_count);
        profile_call_return(frame);
    }
    DISPATCH();
}

17.3.2 Edge Profiling

typedef struct EdgeProfile {
    uint32_t from_pc;
    uint32_t to_pc;
    uint64_t count;
    float probability;  // Cached probability
} EdgeProfile;

static void profile_branch(Frame *frame, uint32_t from, uint32_t to, bool taken) {
    EdgeProfile *edge = get_edge_profile(frame->method, from, to);
    
    if (taken) {
        atomic_increment(&edge->taken_count);
    } else {
        atomic_increment(&edge->not_taken_count);
    }
    
    // Update probability estimate periodically
    uint64_t total = edge->taken_count + edge->not_taken_count;
    if ((total & PROBABILITY_UPDATE_MASK) == 0) {
        edge->probability = (float)edge->taken_count / total;
    }
}

17.3.3 Type Profiling

typedef struct TypeDistribution {
    struct {
        TypeID type;
        uint32_t count;
    } entries[MAX_PROFILE_TYPES];
    
    uint32_t total_count;
    uint8_t num_types;
    bool is_monomorphic;
    bool is_megamorphic;
} TypeDistribution;

static void record_type_profile(TypeProfile *profile, Value value) {
    TypeID type = get_value_type(value);
    TypeDistribution *dist = &profile->receiver_types;
    
    // Fast path for monomorphic case
    if (dist->is_monomorphic && dist->entries[0].type == type) {
        atomic_increment(&dist->entries[0].count);
        atomic_increment(&dist->total_count);
        return;
    }
    
    // Search existing entries
    for (int i = 0; i < dist->num_types; i++) {
        if (dist->entries[i].type == type) {
            atomic_increment(&dist->entries[i].count);
            atomic_increment(&dist->total_count);
            return;
        }
    }
    
    // Add new type
    if (dist->num_types < MAX_PROFILE_TYPES) {
        dist->entries[dist->num_types].type = type;
        dist->entries[dist->num_types].count = 1;
        dist->num_types++;
        dist->is_monomorphic = (dist->num_types == 1);
        atomic_increment(&dist->total_count);
    } else {
        // Megamorphic
        dist->is_megamorphic = true;
    }
}

17.4 Sampling Profiler

17.4.1 Timer-Based Sampling

typedef struct SampleBuffer {
    Sample *samples;
    size_t capacity;
    size_t write_pos;
    size_t read_pos;
    SpinLock lock;
} SampleBuffer;

typedef struct Sample {
    uint64_t timestamp;
    ThreadID thread_id;
    CallStack stack;
    
    // Additional context
    uint64_t cpu_cycles;
    size_t allocated_bytes;
    CacheStats cache_stats;
} Sample;

// Signal handler for sampling
static void sampling_signal_handler(int sig, siginfo_t *info, void *context) {
    if (!vm->profiler.enabled) return;
    
    Thread *thread = get_current_thread();
    if (!thread || thread->in_gc) return;
    
    // Capture stack trace
    Sample sample;
    sample.timestamp = get_timestamp();
    sample.thread_id = thread->id;
    
    // Walk stack quickly
    capture_stack_trace(&sample.stack, context);
    
    // Add CPU performance counters if available
    if (vm->profiler.config.collect_perf_counters) {
        read_perf_counters(&sample);
    }
    
    // Add to buffer (lock-free if possible)
    add_sample_lockfree(&vm->profiler.sample_buffer, &sample);
}

static void setup_sampling_timer(Profiler *profiler) {
    struct sigaction sa;
    struct itimerval timer;
    
    // Setup signal handler
    memset(&sa, 0, sizeof(sa));
    sa.sa_sigaction = sampling_signal_handler;
    sa.sa_flags = SA_SIGINFO | SA_RESTART;
    sigaction(SIGPROF, &sa, NULL);
    
    // Setup interval timer
    timer.it_interval.tv_sec = 0;
    timer.it_interval.tv_usec = profiler->sample_interval;
    timer.it_value = timer.it_interval;
    
    setitimer(ITIMER_PROF, &timer, NULL);
}

17.4.2 Stack Walking

static void capture_stack_trace(CallStack *stack, void *context) {
    ucontext_t *ucontext = (ucontext_t *)context;
    void *pc = (void *)ucontext->uc_mcontext.gregs[REG_RIP];
    void *sp = (void *)ucontext->uc_mcontext.gregs[REG_RSP];
    void *fp = (void *)ucontext->uc_mcontext.gregs[REG_RBP];
    
    stack->depth = 0;
    
    // Walk native and managed frames
    while (fp && stack->depth < MAX_STACK_DEPTH) {
        StackFrame *frame = &stack->frames[stack->depth];
        
        if (is_managed_code(pc)) {
            // Decode managed frame
            ManagedFrame *managed = decode_managed_frame(fp, pc);
            frame->type = FRAME_MANAGED;
            frame->method_id = managed->method->id;
            frame->pc_offset = pc - managed->method->code;
        } else if (is_native_code(pc)) {
            // Native frame
            frame->type = FRAME_NATIVE;
            frame->native_pc = pc;
            frame->symbol = resolve_native_symbol(pc);
        } else if (is_jit_code(pc)) {
            // JIT compiled frame
            frame->type = FRAME_JIT;
            frame->trace_id = find_trace_for_pc(pc);
            frame->pc_offset = pc - get_trace_code(frame->trace_id);
        }
        
        stack->depth++;
        
        // Move to next frame
        void *next_fp = *(void **)fp;
        pc = *((void **)fp + 1);  // Return address
        fp = next_fp;
    }
}

17.5 Instrumentation Framework

17.5.1 Instrumentation Points

typedef enum {
    INSTR_METHOD_ENTER,
    INSTR_METHOD_EXIT,
    INSTR_BASIC_BLOCK,
    INSTR_ALLOCATION,
    INSTR_FIELD_ACCESS,
    INSTR_EXCEPTION,
    INSTR_GC_EVENT,
    INSTR_JIT_EVENT
} InstrumentationPoint;

typedef struct InstrumentationCallback {
    InstrumentationPoint point;
    void (*callback)(InstrumentationContext *ctx);
    void *user_data;
    bool enabled;
} InstrumentationCallback;

// Registration API
void register_instrumentation(InstrumentationPoint point,
                            void (*callback)(InstrumentationContext *),
                            void *user_data) {
    InstrumentationCallback *cb = allocate_callback();
    cb->point = point;
    cb->callback = callback;
    cb->user_data = user_data;
    cb->enabled = true;
    
    add_callback(&vm->profiler.callbacks, cb);
    
    // Update code generation if needed
    if (requires_code_update(point)) {
        invalidate_affected_code(point);
    }
}

17.5.2 Dynamic Instrumentation

typedef struct InstrumentationEngine {
    // Bytecode rewriting
    BytecodeRewriter *rewriter;
    
    // JIT instrumentation
    JITInstrumenter *jit_instrumenter;
    
    // Patch points
    PatchPointTable *patch_points;
    
    // Active instrumentation
    InstrumentationSet *active;
} InstrumentationEngine;

static void instrument_method(Method *method, InstrumentationSet *instr) {
    if (instr->method_entry) {
        inject_method_entry_probe(method);
    }
    
    if (instr->basic_blocks) {
        for (size_t i = 0; i < method->bb_count; i++) {
            inject_bb_probe(method, i);
        }
    }
    
    if (instr->allocations) {
        instrument_allocations(method);
    }
}

// Low-overhead probe implementation
static void inject_method_entry_probe(Method *method) {
    uint8_t *entry = method->bytecode;
    
    // Save original instruction
    uint8_t saved[PROBE_SIZE];
    memcpy(saved, entry, PROBE_SIZE);
    
    // Inject call to profiling stub
    entry[0] = OP_PROFILE_ENTER;
    entry[1] = (method->id >> 8) & 0xFF;
    entry[2] = method->id & 0xFF;
    
    // Store patch info for removal
    store_patch_info(method, 0, saved, PROBE_SIZE);
}

17.5.3 Performance Counter Integration

typedef struct PerfCounters {
    int fd;                  // perf_event file descriptor
    uint64_t *mmap_page;    // mmap'd counter values
    
    struct {
        uint64_t cycles;
        uint64_t instructions;
        uint64_t cache_misses;
        uint64_t branch_misses;
    } values;
} PerfCounters;

static void setup_perf_counters(Thread *thread) {
    struct perf_event_attr attr = {
        .type = PERF_TYPE_HARDWARE,
        .size = sizeof(attr),
        .config = PERF_COUNT_HW_CPU_CYCLES,
        .disabled = 1,
        .exclude_kernel = 1,
        .exclude_hv = 1
    };
    
    thread->perf.fd = syscall(__NR_perf_event_open, 
                              &attr, 0, -1, -1, 0);
    
    if (thread->perf.fd >= 0) {
        thread->perf.mmap_page = mmap(NULL, PAGE_SIZE,
                                      PROT_READ, MAP_SHARED,
                                      thread->perf.fd, 0);
        
        // Enable counters
        ioctl(thread->perf.fd, PERF_EVENT_IOC_ENABLE, 0);
    }
}

static inline uint64_t read_perf_counter(Thread *thread) {
    if (thread->perf.mmap_page) {
        struct perf_event_mmap_page *pc = 
            (struct perf_event_mmap_page *)thread->perf.mmap_page;
        
        uint32_t seq, idx;
        uint64_t count;
        
        do {
            seq = pc->lock;
            barrier();
            
            idx = pc->index;
            count = pc->offset;
            
            if (idx) {
                count += rdpmc(idx - 1);
            }
            
            barrier();
        } while (pc->lock != seq);
        
        return count;
    }
    return 0;
}

17.6 Profile-Guided Optimization

17.6.1 Hot Spot Detection

typedef struct HotSpotDetector {
    // Thresholds
    uint64_t method_threshold;
    uint64_t loop_threshold;
    uint64_t trace_threshold;
    
    // Decay for adaptive thresholds
    float decay_rate;
    uint64_t check_interval;
    
    // Hot spot queues
    PriorityQueue *hot_methods;
    PriorityQueue *hot_loops;
} HotSpotDetector;

static void detect_hot_spots(Profiler *profiler) {
    uint64_t current_time = get_timestamp();
    
    // Check methods
    for (size_t i = 0; i < profiler->database->method_count; i++) {
        MethodProfile *profile = profiler->database->method_profiles[i];
        
        if (profile->invocation_count > profiler->hot_spot_detector->method_threshold) {
            // Calculate hotness score
            float score = calculate_hotness_score(profile);
            
            // Add to compilation queue
            if (score > MIN_COMPILATION_SCORE) {
                enqueue_for_compilation(profile->method_id, score);
            }
        }
    }
    
    // Apply decay to thresholds
    apply_threshold_decay(profiler->hot_spot_detector, current_time);
}

static float calculate_hotness_score(MethodProfile *profile) {
    // Combine multiple factors
    float invocation_score = log(profile->invocation_count + 1);
    float time_score = (float)profile->self_cycles / profile->invocation_count;
    float stability_score = calculate_stability(profile);
    
    return invocation_score * time_score * stability_score;
}

17.6.2 Profile Data Analysis

typedef struct ProfileAnalyzer {
    // Analysis results
    TypeSpecializationHints *type_hints;
    InliningCandidates *inline_candidates;
    BranchPredictionHints *branch_hints;
    
    // Statistics
    ProfileStats stats;
} ProfileAnalyzer;

static void analyze_type_profiles(ProfileAnalyzer *analyzer, 
                                 TypeProfile *profile) {
    TypeDistribution *dist = &profile->receiver_types;
    
    if (dist->is_monomorphic) {
        // Generate monomorphic inline cache
        add_type_hint(analyzer->type_hints, 
                     HINT_MONOMORPHIC,
                     dist->entries[0].type);
    } else if (dist->num_types <= POLYMORPHIC_THRESHOLD) {
        // Generate polymorphic inline cache
        TypeID common_types[POLYMORPHIC_THRESHOLD];
        get_most_common_types(dist, common_types, POLYMORPHIC_THRESHOLD);
        
        add_polymorphic_hint(analyzer->type_hints, 
                            common_types,
                            dist->num_types);
    } else {
        // Megamorphic - use generic dispatch
        add_type_hint(analyzer->type_hints, HINT_MEGAMORPHIC, 0);
    }
}

static void identify_inlining_candidates(ProfileAnalyzer *analyzer,
                                       CallSiteProfile *call_site) {
    // Check if call site is hot enough
    if (call_site->call_count < INLINE_THRESHOLD) return;
    
    // Check if target is small enough
    Method *target = get_method(call_site->target_id);
    if (target->bytecode_size > MAX_INLINE_SIZE) return;
    
    // Check if monomorphic
    if (call_site->type_profile.is_monomorphic) {
        float benefit = estimate_inlining_benefit(call_site, target);
        
        if (benefit > MIN_INLINE_BENEFIT) {
            add_inline_candidate(analyzer->inline_candidates,
                               call_site, target, benefit);
        }
    }
}

17.7 Profile Data Management

17.7.1 Efficient Storage

typedef struct ProfileArena {
    uint8_t *memory;
    size_t capacity;
    size_t used;
    
    // Segregated storage by type
    struct {
        void *free_list;
        size_t size;
        size_t count;
    } pools[PROFILE_TYPE_COUNT];
} ProfileArena;

// Lock-free profile counter update
static inline void increment_profile_counter(uint64_t *counter) {
    // Use atomic increment for thread safety
    __atomic_add_fetch(counter, 1, __ATOMIC_RELAXED);
}

// Compact profile storage
typedef struct CompactMethodProfile {
    uint16_t method_id;
    uint16_t flags;
    uint32_t invocation_count;  // Saturating counter
    
    // Variable-length data follows
    // - Basic block counters (if present)
    // - Type profile data (if present)
} CompactMethodProfile;

17.7.2 Profile Serialization

static void serialize_profiles(Profiler *profiler, FILE *file) {
    // Write header
    ProfileHeader header = {
        .magic = PROFILE_MAGIC,
        .version = PROFILE_VERSION,
        .timestamp = get_timestamp(),
        .method_count = profiler->database->method_count
    };
    fwrite(&header, sizeof(header), 1, file);
    
    // Write method profiles
    for (size_t i = 0; i < header.method_count; i++) {
        MethodProfile *profile = profiler->database->method_profiles[i];
        serialize_method_profile(file, profile);
    }
    
    // Write type profiles
    serialize_type_profiles(file, profiler->type_profiles);
}

static void deserialize_profiles(Profiler *profiler, FILE *file) {
    ProfileHeader header;
    fread(&header, sizeof(header), 1, file);
    
    if (header.magic != PROFILE_MAGIC || 
        header.version != PROFILE_VERSION) {
        error("Invalid profile format");
        return;
    }
    
    // Read and merge profiles
    for (size_t i = 0; i < header.method_count; i++) {
        MethodProfile *profile = deserialize_method_profile(file);
        merge_method_profile(profiler->database, profile);
    }
}

17.8 Debugging and Analysis Tools

17.8.1 Profile Visualization

typedef struct ProfileReport {
    // Flat profile
    struct {
        MethodEntry *entries;
        size_t count;
    } flat;
    
    // Call graph
    CallGraphNode *call_graph;
    
    // Hot path analysis
    HotPath *hot_paths;
    size_t hot_path_count;
} ProfileReport;

static void generate_flat_profile(ProfileReport *report, 
                                 ProfileDatabase *db) {
    // Sort methods by self time
    qsort(report->flat.entries, report->flat.count,
          sizeof(MethodEntry), compare_by_self_time);
    
    // Calculate percentages
    uint64_t total_time = calculate_total_time(db);
    
    for (size_t i = 0; i < report->flat.count; i++) {
        MethodEntry *entry = &report->flat.entries[i];
        entry->self_percent = (100.0 * entry->self_time) / total_time;
        entry->cumulative_percent = (100.0 * entry->total_time) / total_time;
    }
}

static void export_flame_graph(ProfileDatabase *db, const char *filename) {
    FILE *file = fopen(filename, "w");
    
    // Export in collapsed stack format
    for (size_t i = 0; i < db->sample_count; i++) {
        Sample *sample = &db->samples[i];
        
        // Build stack string
        char stack_str[MAX_STACK_STRING];
        build_stack_string(sample->stack, stack_str);
        
        fprintf(file, "%s %lu\n", stack_str, sample->weight);
    }
    
    fclose(file);
}

17.8.2 Performance Analysis API

// Public API for performance analysis
typedef struct PerformanceAPI {
    // Start/stop profiling
    void (*start_profiling)(ProfileConfig *config);
    void (*stop_profiling)(void);
    
    // Query profile data
    MethodProfile *(*get_method_profile)(MethodID id);
    TypeProfile *(*get_type_profile)(CallSiteID id);
    
    // Analysis functions
    HotMethod *(*get_hot_methods)(size_t *count);
    CallGraph *(*build_call_graph)(void);
    
    // Export functions
    void (*export_profile)(const char *filename, ProfileFormat format);
    void (*export_trace)(const char *filename, TraceFormat format);
} PerformanceAPI;

// Example usage
static void analyze_application_performance(VM *vm) {
    ProfileConfig config = {
        .sample_interval = 1000,  // microseconds
        .collect_types = true,
        .collect_branches = true,
        .collect_perf_counters = true
    };
    
    vm->perf_api.start_profiling(&config);
    
    // Run application...
    
    vm->perf_api.stop_profiling();
    
    // Analyze results
    size_t hot_count;
    HotMethod *hot_methods = vm->perf_api.get_hot_methods(&hot_count);
    
    for (size_t i = 0; i < hot_count; i++) {
        printf("Hot method: %s - %.2f%% of time\n",
               hot_methods[i].name,
               hot_methods[i].percent_time);
    }
}

Chapter 18: Foreign Function Interface

18.1 Introduction

This chapter details Diyrbal's Foreign Function Interface (FFI) implementation, enabling seamless interoperability with native libraries. Drawing from the uploaded FFI references, we implement a comprehensive system supporting multiple calling conventions, automatic memory management for foreign objects, and safe interaction between managed and unmanaged code.

18.2 FFI Architecture

18.2.1 Core Components

typedef struct FFIEngine {
    // Type system bridge
    FFITypeRegistry *type_registry;
    FFITypeMapper *type_mapper;
    
    // Function management
    FFIFunctionTable *functions;
    FFICallbackTable *callbacks;
    
    // Library management
    DynamicLibraryTable *libraries;
    SymbolResolver *symbol_resolver;
    
    // Memory management
    FFIMemoryManager *memory_manager;
    HandleTable *handle_table;
    
    // Safety and validation
    FFIValidator *validator;
    FFIMarshaller *marshaller;
} FFIEngine;

typedef struct FFIFunction {
    void *native_ptr;           // Native function pointer
    FFISignature *signature;    // Type signature
    CallingConvention convention;
    
    // Metadata
    const char *name;
    const char *library;
    
    // Performance tracking
    uint64_t call_count;
    uint64_t total_time;
    
    // Safety flags
    uint32_t flags;  // UNSAFE, NO_GC, PINNED_ARGS, etc.
} FFIFunction;

18.2.2 Type System Bridge

typedef struct FFIType {
    FFITypeKind kind;
    size_t size;
    size_t alignment;
    
    union {
        struct {
            FFIType *element_type;
            size_t count;
        } array;
        
        struct {
            FFIType **field_types;
            size_t field_count;
            size_t *field_offsets;
        } struct_type;
        
        struct {
            FFIType *return_type;
            FFIType **param_types;
            size_t param_count;
        } function;
    } data;
} FFIType;

// Predefined FFI types matching libffi
static FFIType ffi_type_void = { FFI_TYPE_VOID, 0, 0 };
static FFIType ffi_type_sint8 = { FFI_TYPE_SINT8, 1, 1 };
static FFIType ffi_type_sint32 = { FFI_TYPE_SINT32, 4, 4 };
static FFIType ffi_type_sint64 = { FFI_TYPE_SINT64, 8, 8 };
static FFIType ffi_type_float = { FFI_TYPE_FLOAT, 4, 4 };
static FFIType ffi_type_double = { FFI_TYPE_DOUBLE, 8, 8 };
static FFIType ffi_type_pointer = { FFI_TYPE_POINTER, 8, 8 };

18.3 Function Binding and Calling

18.3.1 Dynamic Library Loading

typedef struct DynamicLibrary {
    void *handle;           // dlopen handle
    const char *path;
    RefCount ref_count;
    
    // Symbol cache
    HashMap *symbol_cache;
    
    // Dependency tracking
    DynamicLibrary **dependencies;
    size_t dep_count;
} DynamicLibrary;

static DynamicLibrary* load_library(FFIEngine *ffi, const char *path) {
    DynamicLibrary *lib = allocate_library();
    
    // Load with appropriate flags
    int flags = RTLD_LAZY | RTLD_LOCAL;
    if (ffi->config.global_symbols) {
        flags |= RTLD_GLOBAL;
    }
    
    lib->handle = dlopen(path, flags);
    if (!lib->handle) {
        error("Failed to load library %s: %s", path, dlerror());
        return NULL;
    }
    
    lib->path = strdup(path);
