    lib->symbol_cache = hashmap_create();
    
    // Initialize library if it has constructors
    void (*init_func)(void) = dlsym(lib->handle, "_init");
    if (init_func) {
        init_func();
    }
    
    return lib;
}

18.3.2 Function Resolution and Binding

static FFIFunction* bind_function(FFIEngine *ffi,
                                  const char *name,
                                  FFISignature *signature,
                                  DynamicLibrary *lib) {
    // Resolve symbol
    void *symbol = dlsym(lib->handle, name);
    if (!symbol) {
        // Try mangled names for C++
        char mangled[256];
        if (try_demangle(name, mangled, sizeof(mangled))) {
            symbol = dlsym(lib->handle, mangled);
        }
    }
    
    if (!symbol) {
        error("Symbol not found: %s", name);
        return NULL;
    }
    
    // Create FFI function
    FFIFunction *func = allocate_ffi_function();
    func->native_ptr = symbol;
    func->signature = signature;
    func->name = strdup(name);
    func->library = lib->path;
    
    // Prepare CIF (Call Interface) for libffi
    prepare_ffi_cif(func);
    
    // Add to function table
    register_ffi_function(ffi, func);
    
    return func;
}

static void prepare_ffi_cif(FFIFunction *func) {
    ffi_cif *cif = &func->cif;
    FFISignature *sig = func->signature;
    
    // Convert our types to libffi types
    ffi_type **arg_types = allocate_type_array(sig->param_count);
    for (size_t i = 0; i < sig->param_count; i++) {
        arg_types[i] = convert_to_ffi_type(sig->param_types[i]);
    }
    
    ffi_type *return_type = convert_to_ffi_type(sig->return_type);
    
    // Prepare the CIF
    ffi_status status = ffi_prep_cif(cif, FFI_DEFAULT_ABI,
                                     sig->param_count,
                                     return_type,
                                     arg_types);
    
    if (status != FFI_OK) {
        error("Failed to prepare FFI CIF: %d", status);
    }
}

18.3.3 Foreign Function Invocation

static Value call_ffi_function(FFIFunction *func, Value *args, size_t arg_count) {
    // Validate arguments
    if (!validate_ffi_call(func, args, arg_count)) {
        error("FFI call validation failed");
        return NIL_VAL;
    }
    
    // Pin objects if needed (for GC safety)
    PinnedObjects pinned = pin_ffi_arguments(func, args, arg_count);
    
    // Marshal arguments
    void **native_args = marshal_arguments(func, args, arg_count);
    void *return_buffer = allocate_return_buffer(func->signature->return_type);
    
    // Mark as in foreign call (for GC coordination)
    Thread *thread = get_current_thread();
    thread->in_foreign_call = true;
    
    // Timing for profiling
    uint64_t start_time = get_timestamp();
    
    // Actual FFI call using libffi
    ffi_call(&func->cif, func->native_ptr, return_buffer, native_args);
    
    // Update profiling info
    func->call_count++;
    func->total_time += get_timestamp() - start_time;
    
    thread->in_foreign_call = false;
    
    // Unmarshal return value
    Value result = unmarshal_return_value(func->signature->return_type,
                                          return_buffer);
    
    // Cleanup
    unpin_objects(&pinned);
    free_marshal_buffers(native_args, return_buffer);
    
    return result;
}

18.4 Type Marshalling

18.4.1 Primitive Type Marshalling

typedef struct Marshaller {
    // Type conversion functions
    void* (*to_native)(Value value, FFIType *type);
    Value (*from_native)(void *native, FFIType *type);
    
    // Buffer management
    MarshalBuffer *buffer_pool;
    size_t buffer_size;
} Marshaller;

static void* marshal_primitive(Value value, FFIType *type) {
    void *buffer = allocate_marshal_buffer(type->size);
    
    switch (type->kind) {
    case FFI_TYPE_SINT32:
        *(int32_t*)buffer = value_to_int32(value);
        break;
        
    case FFI_TYPE_SINT64:
        *(int64_t*)buffer = value_to_int64(value);
        break;
        
    case FFI_TYPE_FLOAT:
        *(float*)buffer = value_to_float(value);
        break;
        
    case FFI_TYPE_DOUBLE:
        *(double*)buffer = value_to_double(value);
        break;
        
    case FFI_TYPE_POINTER:
        if (IS_STRING(value)) {
            // Convert string to C string
            *(char**)buffer = value_to_cstring(value);
        } else if (IS_BUFFER(value)) {
            // Get buffer pointer
            *(void**)buffer = get_buffer_data(value);
        } else {
            *(void**)buffer = NULL;
        }
        break;
    }
    
    return buffer;
}

18.4.2 Complex Type Marshalling

static void* marshal_struct(Value value, FFIType *struct_type) {
    if (!IS_OBJECT(value)) {
        error("Expected object for struct marshalling");
        return NULL;
    }
    
    size_t struct_size = struct_type->size;
    void *buffer = allocate_marshal_buffer(struct_size);
    
    Object *obj = AS_OBJECT(value);
    
    for (size_t i = 0; i < struct_type->data.struct_type.field_count; i++) {
        FFIType *field_type = struct_type->data.struct_type.field_types[i];
        size_t offset = struct_type->data.struct_type.field_offsets[i];
        
        // Get field value from object
        Value field_value = get_object_field(obj, i);
        
        // Marshal field
        void *field_buffer = marshal_value(field_value, field_type);
        
        // Copy to struct buffer
        memcpy((char*)buffer + offset, field_buffer, field_type->size);
    }
    
    return buffer;
}

static Value unmarshal_struct(void *native, FFIType *struct_type) {
    // Create object to hold struct fields
    Object *obj = allocate_object(struct_type->data.struct_type.field_count);
    
    for (size_t i = 0; i < struct_type->data.struct_type.field_count; i++) {
        FFIType *field_type = struct_type->data.struct_type.field_types[i];
        size_t offset = struct_type->data.struct_type.field_offsets[i];
        
        // Unmarshal field
        void *field_ptr = (char*)native + offset;
        Value field_value = unmarshal_value(field_ptr, field_type);
        
        // Set field in object
        set_object_field(obj, i, field_value);
    }
    
    return OBJECT_VAL(obj);
}

18.4.3 String and Buffer Handling

typedef struct StringMarshaller {
    // String encoding
    Encoding default_encoding;
    
    // String pools for efficiency
    StringPool *cstring_pool;
    
    // Null termination handling
    bool auto_null_terminate;
} StringMarshaller;

static char* marshal_string(String *str, Encoding encoding) {
    // Check if already cached
    char *cached = string_pool_get(vm->ffi.string_pool, str);
    if (cached) return cached;
    
    // Convert encoding if needed
    if (str->encoding != encoding) {
        str = convert_string_encoding(str, encoding);
    }
    
    // Allocate C string
    size_t len = str->length;
    char *cstr = allocate_cstring(len + 1);
    memcpy(cstr, str->data, len);
    cstr[len] = '\0';
    
    // Cache for reuse
    string_pool_put(vm->ffi.string_pool, str, cstr);
    
    return cstr;
}

static String* unmarshal_string(const char *cstr, Encoding encoding) {
    if (!cstr) return NULL;
    
    size_t len = strlen(cstr);
    String *str = allocate_string(len);
    
    memcpy(str->data, cstr, len);
    str->length = len;
    str->encoding = encoding;
    
    return str;
}

18.5 Callback Support

18.5.1 Managed to Native Callbacks

typedef struct FFICallback {
    Value callable;           // Managed function/closure
    FFISignature *signature;
    
    // Trampoline for native code
    void *trampoline;
    ffi_closure *closure;
    
    // Reference tracking
    uint32_t ref_count;
    bool is_permanent;
} FFICallback;

static void* create_callback(Value callable, FFISignature *signature) {
    FFICallback *callback = allocate_ffi_callback();
    callback->callable = callable;
    callback->signature = signature;
    
    // Create closure using libffi
    callback->closure = ffi_closure_alloc(sizeof(ffi_closure),
                                          &callback->trampoline);
    
    if (!callback->closure) {
        error("Failed to allocate FFI closure");
        return NULL;
    }
    
    // Prepare closure
    ffi_cif *cif = prepare_callback_cif(signature);
    
    ffi_status status = ffi_prep_closure_loc(callback->closure, cif,
                                             callback_handler,
                                             callback,
                                             callback->trampoline);
    
    if (status != FFI_OK) {
        error("Failed to prepare FFI closure: %d", status);
        return NULL;
    }
    
    // Register callback to prevent GC
    register_callback(vm->ffi.callbacks, callback);
    
    return callback->trampoline;
}

static void callback_handler(ffi_cif *cif, void *ret, 
                            void **args, void *user_data) {
    FFICallback *callback = (FFICallback*)user_data;
    
    // Enter VM context
    Thread *thread = get_or_create_thread();
    VMContext ctx = enter_vm_from_native(thread);
    
    // Unmarshal arguments
    size_t arg_count = callback->signature->param_count;
    Value *managed_args = allocate_value_array(arg_count);
    
    for (size_t i = 0; i < arg_count; i++) {
        managed_args[i] = unmarshal_value(args[i],
                                         callback->signature->param_types[i]);
    }
    
    // Call managed function
    Value result = call_value(callback->callable, managed_args, arg_count);
    
    // Marshal return value
    if (callback->signature->return_type->kin
# Chapter 19: Concurrency and Parallelism

## 19.1 Introduction

This chapter explores Diyrbal's concurrency model, which draws inspiration from Joe Armstrong's actor model (as seen in the uploaded thesis on concurrency) while incorporating modern parallel execution capabilities. We implement lightweight threads, message passing, shared-nothing architecture, and efficient work-stealing for CPU-bound tasks.

## 19.2 Concurrency Model Overview

### 19.2.1 Core Concepts
```c
typedef struct ConcurrencyEngine {
    // Thread management
    ThreadPool *thread_pool;
    LightweightThreadScheduler *lwt_scheduler;
    
    // Message passing
    MessageQueue *global_mailbox;
    MessageRouter *router;
    
    // Synchronization primitives
    LockManager *lock_manager;
    AtomicOpsTable *atomic_ops;
    
    // Work distribution
    WorkStealingQueue **work_queues;
    LoadBalancer *load_balancer;
    
    // Monitoring
    ConcurrencyMonitor *monitor;
    DeadlockDetector *deadlock_detector;
} ConcurrencyEngine;

typedef struct LightweightThread {
    ThreadID id;
    ThreadState state;
    
    // Execution context
    Value *stack;
    size_t stack_size;
    RegisterSet registers;
    
    // Message handling
    MessageQueue *mailbox;
    MessagePattern *receive_patterns;
    
    // Scheduling info
    uint64_t priority;
    uint64_t quantum_remaining;
    
    // Links and monitors
    ThreadID *linked_threads;
    ThreadID *monitoring_threads;
} LightweightThread;

19.2.2 Actor-Based Architecture

typedef struct Actor {
    LightweightThread *thread;
    ActorBehavior *behavior;
    
    // State isolation
    Heap *private_heap;
    Value state;
    
    // Supervision
    ActorID supervisor;
    SupervisionStrategy strategy;
    
    // Lifecycle
    ActorState lifecycle_state;
    uint64_t restart_count;
} Actor;

typedef struct Message {
    MessageID id;
    ActorID sender;
    ActorID receiver;
    
    // Payload
    Value content;
    MessageType type;
    
    // Delivery guarantees
    DeliveryMode mode;  // AT_MOST_ONCE, EXACTLY_ONCE
    uint64_t timeout;
    
    // Tracing
    uint64_t timestamp;
    SpanContext trace_context;
} Message;

19.3 Lightweight Thread Implementation

19.3.1 Thread Creation and Management

static LightweightThread* create_lightweight_thread(Value entry_point,
                                                   Value *args,
                                                   size_t arg_count) {
    LightweightThread *thread = allocate_lwt();
    
    // Allocate stack (small initial size)
    thread->stack_size = INITIAL_LWT_STACK_SIZE;  // 8KB
    thread->stack = allocate_stack(thread->stack_size);
    
    // Initialize registers
    thread->registers.sp = thread->stack + thread->stack_size;
    thread->registers.fp = thread->registers.sp;
    thread->registers.ip = get_entry_address(entry_point);
    
    // Setup initial frame
    push_frame(&thread->registers, entry_point, args, arg_count);
    
    // Create mailbox
    thread->mailbox = create_message_queue(DEFAULT_MAILBOX_SIZE);
    
    // Set initial state
    thread->state = THREAD_READY;
    thread->quantum_remaining = DEFAULT_QUANTUM;
    
    // Register with scheduler
    schedule_thread(vm->concurrency.lwt_scheduler, thread);
    
    return thread;
}

static void schedule_thread(LightweightThreadScheduler *scheduler,
                           LightweightThread *thread) {
    // Add to appropriate run queue based on priority
    RunQueue *queue = get_priority_queue(scheduler, thread->priority);
    
    acquire_spinlock(&queue->lock);
    enqueue_thread(queue, thread);
    release_spinlock(&queue->lock);
    
    // Wake idle worker if available
    wake_idle_worker(scheduler);
}

19.3.2 Cooperative and Preemptive Scheduling

typedef struct LightweightThreadScheduler {
    // Multi-level priority queues
    RunQueue *priority_queues[NUM_PRIORITIES];
    
    // Worker threads
    WorkerThread *workers;
    size_t worker_count;
    
    // Scheduling policy
    SchedulingPolicy policy;
    uint64_t time_slice_ns;
    
    // Load tracking
    LoadStatistics *load_stats;
    
    // Timer for preemption
    TimerHandle preemption_timer;
} LightweightThreadScheduler;

static void worker_thread_loop(WorkerThread *worker) {
    while (!worker->shutdown) {
        LightweightThread *thread = get_next_thread(worker);
        
        if (!thread) {
            // Try work stealing
            thread = steal_work(worker);
            if (!thread) {
                // Park worker
                park_worker(worker);
                continue;
            }
        }
        
        // Execute thread
        execute_lightweight_thread(worker, thread);
    }
}

static void execute_lightweight_thread(WorkerThread *worker,
                                      LightweightThread *thread) {
    // Set current thread context
    worker->current_thread = thread;
    thread->state = THREAD_RUNNING;
    
    // Start preemption timer if needed
    if (scheduler->policy == PREEMPTIVE) {
        arm_preemption_timer(thread->quantum_remaining);
    }
    
    // Restore thread context
    restore_context(&thread->registers);
    
    // Execute until yield/preemption/completion
    ExecutionResult result = run_thread_quantum(thread);
    
    // Save context if not completed
    if (result != THREAD_COMPLETED) {
        save_context(&thread->registers);
        
        // Reschedule based on result
        switch (result) {
        case QUANTUM_EXPIRED:
            thread->quantum_remaining = DEFAULT_QUANTUM;
            thread->state = THREAD_READY;
            schedule_thread(scheduler, thread);
            break;
            
        case THREAD_YIELDED:
            thread->state = THREAD_READY;
            schedule_thread(scheduler, thread);
            break;
            
        case THREAD_BLOCKED:
            thread->state = THREAD_BLOCKED;
            // Will be rescheduled when unblocked
            break;
        }
    } else {
        // Thread completed
        cleanup_thread(thread);
    }
    
    worker->current_thread = NULL;
}

19.4 Message Passing System

19.4.1 Asynchronous Message Passing

static void send_message(ActorID sender, ActorID receiver, Value content) {
    Message *msg = allocate_message();
    msg->id = generate_message_id();
    msg->sender = sender;
    msg->receiver = receiver;
    msg->content = copy_value_deep(content);  // Immutable messages
    msg->timestamp = get_timestamp();
    
    // Route message
    Actor *target = lookup_actor(receiver);
    if (!target) {
        handle_dead_letter(msg);
        return;
    }
    
    // Enqueue in target's mailbox
    MessageQueue *mailbox = target->thread->mailbox;
    if (!enqueue_message(mailbox, msg)) {
        // Mailbox full
        handle_mailbox_overflow(target, msg);
    }
    
    // Wake target if sleeping
    if (target->thread->state == THREAD_BLOCKED_RECEIVE) {
        target->thread->state = THREAD_READY;
        schedule_thread(scheduler, target->thread);
    }
}

static Value receive_message(Actor *actor, MessagePattern *patterns,
                           uint64_t timeout_ms) {
    LightweightThread *thread = actor->thread;
    MessageQueue *mailbox = thread->mailbox;
    
    uint64_t deadline = get_timestamp() + timeout_ms * 1000000;
    
    while (true) {
        // Try to match message
        Message *msg = dequeue_matching_message(mailbox, patterns);
        if (msg) {
            Value result = msg->content;
            free_message(msg);
            return result;
        }
        
        // Check timeout
        if (get_timestamp() >= deadline) {
            return TIMEOUT_VAL;
        }
        
        // Block thread
        thread->state = THREAD_BLOCKED_RECEIVE;
        thread->receive_patterns = patterns;
        
        // Yield to scheduler
        yield_thread();
    }
}

19.4.2 Selective Receive and Pattern Matching

typedef struct MessagePattern {
    PatternType type;
    
    union {
        struct {
            Value pattern;
            GuardFunction guard;
        } value_pattern;
        
        struct {
            ActorID sender;
            MessageType type;
        } sender_pattern;
        
        struct {
            PatternPredicate predicate;
            void *context;
        } predicate_pattern;
    } data;
    
    MessagePattern *next;  // For pattern chains
} MessagePattern;

static Message* dequeue_matching_message(MessageQueue *queue,
                                       MessagePattern *patterns) {
    acquire_lock(&queue->lock);
    
    Message *prev = NULL;
    Message *current = queue->head;
    
    while (current) {
        if (matches_any_pattern(current, patterns)) {
            // Remove from queue
            if (prev) {
                prev->next = current->next;
            } else {
                queue->head = current->next;
            }
            
            if (!current->next) {
                queue->tail = prev;
            }
            
            queue->size--;
            release_lock(&queue->lock);
            return current;
        }
        
        prev = current;
        current = current->next;
    }
    
    release_lock(&queue->lock);
    return NULL;
}

static bool matches_pattern(Message *msg, MessagePattern *pattern) {
    switch (pattern->type) {
    case PATTERN_VALUE:
        return match_value_pattern(msg->content,
                                   pattern->data.value_pattern.pattern) &&
               (!pattern->data.value_pattern.guard ||
                pattern->data.value_pattern.guard(msg));
                
    case PATTERN_SENDER:
        return msg->sender == pattern->data.sender_pattern.sender &&
               msg->type == pattern->data.sender_pattern.type;
               
    case PATTERN_PREDICATE:
        return pattern->data.predicate_pattern.predicate(
            msg, pattern->data.predicate_pattern.context);
    }
    
    return false;
}

19.5 Parallel Execution

19.5.1 Work-Stealing Implementation

typedef struct WorkStealingQueue {
    // Chase-Lev deque for work stealing
    atomic_size_t top;
    atomic_size_t bottom;
    
    // Circular buffer
    Task **tasks;
    size_t capacity;
    
    // Owner worker
    WorkerID owner;
} WorkStealingQueue;

static void push_task(WorkStealingQueue *queue, Task *task) {
    size_t b = atomic_load(&queue->bottom);
    size_t t = atomic_load(&queue->top);
    
    if (b - t >= queue->capacity - 1) {
        // Queue full, resize
        resize_queue(queue);
    }
    
    queue->tasks[b & (queue->capacity - 1)] = task;
    atomic_fence();  // Memory barrier
    atomic_store(&queue->bottom, b + 1);
}

static Task* pop_task(WorkStealingQueue *queue) {
    size_t b = atomic_load(&queue->bottom) - 1;
    atomic_store(&queue->bottom, b);
    atomic_fence();
    
    size_t t = atomic_load(&queue->top);
    
    if (t <= b) {
        // Non-empty queue
        Task *task = queue->tasks[b & (queue->capacity - 1)];
        
        if (t == b) {
            // Last element - need CAS
            if (!atomic_compare_exchange(&queue->top, &t, t + 1)) {
                // Failed race
                atomic_store(&queue->bottom, b + 1);
                return NULL;
            }
            atomic_store(&queue->bottom, b + 1);
        }
        return task;
    } else {
        // Empty queue
        atomic_store(&queue->bottom, b + 1);
        return NULL;
    }
}

static Task* steal_task(WorkStealingQueue *queue) {
    size_t t = atomic_load(&queue->top);
    atomic_fence();
    size_t b = atomic_load(&queue->bottom);
    
    if (t < b) {
        Task *task = queue->tasks[t & (queue->capacity - 1)];
        
        if (atomic_compare_exchange(&queue->top, &t, t + 1)) {
            return task;
        }
    }
    
    return NULL;
}

19.5.2 Parallel Constructs

// Parallel map implementation
static Value parallel_map(Value collection, Value function) {
    size_t size = get_collection_size(collection);
    
    // Determine parallelism level
    size_t num_workers = min(size, vm->concurrency.worker_count);
    size_t chunk_size = (size + num_workers - 1) / num_workers;
    
    // Create tasks
    ParallelTask *tasks = allocate_tasks(num_workers);
    Value *results = allocate_value_array(size);
    
    for (size_t i = 0; i < num_workers; i++) {
        tasks[i].function = function;
        tasks[i].start = i * chunk_size;
        tasks[i].end = min((i + 1) * chunk_size, size);
        tasks[i].input = collection;
        tasks[i].output = results;
        
        submit_parallel_task(&tasks[i]);
    }
    
    // Wait for completion
    wait_all_tasks(tasks, num_workers);
    
    // Build result collection
    return create_collection_from_array(results, size);
}

// Fork-join parallelism
static Value fork_join(TaskGroup *group) {
    // Submit all tasks
    for (size_t i = 0; i < group->task_count; i++) {
        push_task(get_worker_queue(current_worker()), &group->tasks[i]);
    }
    
    // Help with execution
    while (!all_tasks_complete(group)) {
        Task *task = pop_task(get_worker_queue(current_worker()));
        if (!task) {
            task = steal_from_others(current_worker());
        }
        
        if (task && task->group == group) {
            execute_task(task);
        }
    }
    
    // Combine results
    return reduce_task_results(group);
}

19.6 Synchronization Primitives

19.6.1 Lock-Free Data Structures

typedef struct LockFreeStack {
    atomic_ptr_t head;
} LockFreeStack;

static void push_lockfree(LockFreeStack *stack, Node *node) {
    do {
        Node *head = atomic_load(&stack->head);
        node->next = head;
    } while (!atomic_compare_exchange_weak(&stack->head, &node->next, node));
}

static Node* pop_lockfree(LockFreeStack *stack) {
    Node *head;
    do {
        head = atomic_load(&stack->head);
        if (!head) return NULL;
    } while (!atomic_compare_exchange_weak(&stack->head, &head, head->next));
    
    return head;
}

// Lock-free queue (Michael & Scott algorithm)
typedef struct LockFreeQueue {
    atomic_ptr_t head;
    atomic_ptr_t tail;
} LockFreeQueue;

static void enqueue_lockfree(LockFreeQueue *queue, Node *node) {
    node->next = NULL;
    
    while (true) {
        Node *tail = atomic_load(&queue->tail);
        Node *next = atomic_load(&tail->next);
        
        if (tail == atomic_load(&queue->tail)) {
            if (next == NULL) {
                if (atomic_compare_exchange(&tail->next, &next, node)) {
                    atomic_compare_exchange(&queue->tail, &tail, node);
                    break;
                }
            } else {
                atomic_compare_exchange(&queue->tail, &tail, next);
            }
        }
    }
}

19.6.2 Software Transactional Memory

typedef struct STMTransaction {
    TransactionID id;
    TransactionState state;
    
    // Read and write sets
    ReadSet *read_set;
    WriteSet *write_set;
    
    // Version tracking
    uint64_t start_version;
    
    // Retry management
    WatchSet *watch_set;
    ConditionVar retry_condition;
} STMTransaction;

static Value stm_read(STMTransaction *tx, STMVar *var) {
    // Check write set first
    WriteEntry *entry = find_in_write_set(tx->write_set, var);
    if (entry) {
        return entry->value;
    }
    
    // Add to read set
    add_to_read_set(tx->read_set, var, var->version);
    
    return var->value;
}

static void stm_write(STMTransaction *tx, STMVar *var, Value value) {
    add_to_write_set(tx->write_set, var, value);
}

static bool stm_commit(STMTransaction *tx) {
    // Validate read set
    if (!validate_read_set(tx)) {
        rollback_transaction(tx);
        return false;
    }
    
    // Lock write set
    if (!lock_write_set(tx)) {
        rollback_transaction(tx);
        return false;
    }
    
    // Revalidate under locks
    if (!validate_read_set(tx)) {
        unlock_write_set(tx);
        rollback_transaction(tx);
        return false;
    }
    
    // Commit writes
    commit_write_set(tx);
    
    // Update versions and unlock
    update_versions(tx);
    unlock_write_set(tx);
    
    // Notify waiters
    notify_waiters(tx);
    
    return true;
}

19.7 Fault Tolerance and Supervision

19.7.1 Supervisor Trees

typedef struct Supervisor {
    Actor base;
    
    // Children management
    ActorID *children;
    size_t child_count;
    size_t max_children;
    
    // Restart strategy
    RestartStrategy strategy;
    uint32_t max_restarts;
    uint64_t restart_window_ms;
    
    // Restart tracking
    RestartRecord *restart_history;
    size_t history_size;
} Supervisor;

typedef enum {
    ONE_FOR_ONE,    // Restart only failed child
    ONE_FOR_ALL,    // Restart all children
    REST_FOR_ONE    // Restart failed child and those started after it
} RestartStrategy;

static void handle_child_failure(Supervisor *sup, ActorID failed_child,
                                FailureReason reason) {
    // Check restart frequency
    if (exceeds_restart_threshold(sup)) {
        // Escalate to parent supervisor
        escalate_failure(sup->base.supervisor, sup->base.id, reason);
        return;
    }
    
    // Record restart
    record_restart(sup, failed_child, reason);
    
    // Apply restart strategy
    switch (sup->strategy) {
    case ONE_FOR_ONE:
        restart_actor(failed_child);
        break;
        
    case ONE_FOR_ALL:
        for (size_t i = 0; i < sup->child_count; i++) {
            terminate_actor(sup->children[i]);
        }
        for (size_t i = 0; i < sup->child_count; i++) {
            restart_actor(sup->children[i]);
        }
        break;
        
    case REST_FOR_ONE:
        size_t failed_index = find_child_index(sup, failed_child);
        for (size_t i = failed_index; i < sup->child_count; i++) {
            terminate_actor(sup->children[i]);
        }
        for (size_t i = failed_index; i < sup->child_count; i++) {
            restart_actor(sup->children[i]);
        }
        break;
    }
}

19.7.2 Process Linking and Monitoring

static void link_actors(ActorID actor1, ActorID actor2) {
    Actor *a1 = lookup_actor(actor1);
    Actor *a2 = lookup_actor(actor2);
    
    // Add bidirectional link
    add_link(a1, actor2);
    add_link(a2, actor1);
}

static void monitor_actor(ActorID monitor, ActorID monitored) {
    Actor *target = lookup_actor(monitored);
    
    // Add monitor
    add_monitor(target, monitor);
    
    // Send immediate DOWN if already terminated
    if (target->lifecycle_state == ACTOR_TERMINATED) {
        send_down_message(monitor, monitored, target->exit_reason);
    }
}

static void propagate_exit(Actor *actor, ExitReason reason) {
    // Notify monitors
    for (size_t i = 0; i < actor->monitor_count; i++) {
        send_down_message(actor->monitors[i], actor->id, reason);
    }
    
    // Propagate to linked actors
    if (reason != NORMAL_EXIT || actor->trap_exit) {
        for (size_t i = 0; i < actor->link_count; i++) {
            Actor *linked = lookup_actor(actor->links[i]);
            
            if (linked->trap_exit) {
                // Convert to message
                send_exit_message(linked->id, actor->id, reason);
            } else {
                // Propagate termination
                terminate_actor_with_reason(linked->id, reason);
            }
        }
    }
}

19.8 Performance Optimization

19.8.1 NUMA-Aware Scheduling

typedef struct NUMAScheduler {
    // NUMA topology
    NUMANode *nodes;
    size_t node_count;
    
    // Per-node queues
    RunQueue **node_queues;
    
    // Memory allocation
    NUMAAllocator *allocator;
    
    // Load balancing
    NUMABalancer *balancer;
} NUMAScheduler;

static void numa_aware_schedule(LightweightThread *thread) {
    // Determine preferred NUMA node
    int preferred_node = get_thread_numa_node(thread);
    
    if (preferred_node >= 0) {
        // Try to schedule on preferred node
        RunQueue *node_queue = numa_scheduler->node_queues[preferred_node];
        
        if (try_enqueue_local(node_queue, thread)) {
            return;
        }
    }
    
    // Fallback to least loaded node
    int target_node = find_least_loaded_node();
    enqueue_thread(numa_scheduler->node_queues[target_node], thread);
}

static void* numa_aware_allocate(size_t size, int numa_node) {
    if (numa_node < 0) {
        // Use current thread's node
        numa_node = numa_node_of_cpu(sched_getcpu());
    }
    
    // Allocate from node-local memory
    void *ptr = numa_alloc_onnode(size, numa_node);
    
    if (!ptr) {
        // Fallback to any node
        ptr = numa_alloc(size);
    }
    
    return ptr;
}

19.8.2 Cache-Conscious Message Passing

typedef struct CacheLineAlignedMessage {
    // Align to cache line to prevent false sharing
    alignas(CACHE_LINE_SIZE) Message msg;
    
    // Padding for next message
    char padding[CACHE_LINE_SIZE - (sizeof(Message) % CACHE_LINE_SIZE)];
} CacheLineAlignedMessage;

typedef struct MessageBatch {
    CacheLineAlignedMessage *messages;
    size_t count;
    size_t capacity;
    
    // Batch metadata
    ActorID sender;
    ActorID receiver;
    uint64_t batch_id;
} MessageBatch;

static void send_message_batch(MessageBatch *batch) {
    Actor *target = lookup_actor(batch->receiver);
    MessageQueue *mailbox = target->thread->mailbox;
    
    // Try to enqueue entire batch atomically
    if (mailbox->free_space >= batch->count) {
        acquire_lock(&mailbox->lock);
        
        // Copy messages in bulk
        memcpy(mailbox->tail, batch->messages, 
               batch->count * sizeof(CacheLineAlignedMessage));
        
        mailbox->tail += batch->count;
        mailbox->size += batch->count;
        
        release_lock(&mailbox->lock);
        
        // Single wake-up for entire batch
        if (target->thread->state == THREAD_BLOCKED_RECEIVE) {
            wake_thread(target->thread);
        }
    }
}

This chapter establishes Diyrbal's comprehensive concurrency framework, combining actor-model message passing with efficient parallel execution primitives. The implementation focuses on scalability, fault tolerance, and cache-conscious design for modern multi-core systems.

Appendix A: Bytecode Instruction Reference & Compilation Schemes

A.1 Introduction

This appendix provides a comprehensive reference for Diyrbal's bytecode instruction set, drawing from the compilation schemes detailed in the uploaded VM design references. Each instruction is documented with its opcode, operand format, stack behavior, and compilation patterns.

A.2 Instruction Format

A.2.1 Basic Encoding

typedef struct Instruction {
    uint8_t opcode;      // Primary opcode (0-255)
    uint8_t flags;       // Instruction flags/modifiers
    uint16_t operand;    // 16-bit immediate operand
} __attribute__((packed)) Instruction;

// Extended format for larger operands
typedef struct ExtendedInstruction {
    uint8_t opcode;      // Must be OP_EXTENDED
    uint8_t ext_opcode;  // Extended opcode
    uint16_t reserved;
    uint32_t operand;    // 32-bit operand
} __attribute__((packed)) ExtendedInstruction;

// Instruction flags
#define FLAG_WIDE     0x01  // Wide operand follows
#define FLAG_TYPED    0x02  // Type-specialized variant
#define FLAG_PROFILE  0x04  // Profiling enabled
#define FLAG_DEBUG    0x08  // Debug info present

A.3 Stack Manipulation Instructions

A.3.1 Load/Store Operations

OP_LOAD_CONST (0x00) Format: [opcode][index:16] Stack: [] → [const] Action: Push constant from constant pool Example: LOAD_CONST #5 // Push constant at index 5

OP_LOAD_LOCAL (0x01) Format: [opcode][slot:16] Stack: [] → [value] Action: Load from local variable slot Compilation: codeV(x, ρ, sl) = LOAD_LOCAL ρ(x)

OP_STORE_LOCAL (0x02) Format: [opcode][slot:16] Stack: [value] → [] Action: Store to local variable slot Compilation: codeL(x, ρ, sl) = STORE_LOCAL ρ(x)

OP_LOAD_GLOBAL (0x03) Format: [opcode][index:16] Stack: [] → [value] Action: Load from global variable Note: Index refers to global variable table

OP_STORE_GLOBAL (0x04) Format: [opcode][index:16] Stack: [value] → [] Action: Store to global variable

A.3.2 Stack Operations

OP_DUP (0x05) Format: [opcode] Stack: [a] → [a][a] Action: Duplicate top of stack

OP_DUP2 (0x06) Format: [opcode] Stack: [a][b] → [a][b][a][b] Action: Duplicate top two stack values

OP_SWAP (0x07) Format: [opcode] Stack: [a][b] → [b][a] Action: Swap top two values

OP_ROT3 (0x08) Format: [opcode] Stack: [a][b][c] → [c][a][b] Action: Rotate top three values

OP_POP (0x09) Format: [opcode] Stack: [a] → [] Action: Discard top value

OP_POP_N (0x0A) Format: [opcode][count:16] Stack: [v1]...[vn] → [] Action: Pop n values from stack

A.4 Arithmetic and Logical Instructions

A.4.1 Integer Arithmetic

OP_ADD_INT (0x10) Format: [opcode] Stack: [a:int][b:int] → [a+b:int] Action: Integer addition Flags: Sets overflow flag if applicable

OP_SUB_INT (0x11) Format: [opcode] Stack: [a:int][b:int] → [a-b:int] Action: Integer subtraction

OP_MUL_INT (0x12) Format: [opcode] Stack: [a:int][b:int] → [a*b:int] Action: Integer multiplication

OP_DIV_INT (0x13) Format: [opcode] Stack: [a:int][b:int] → [a/b:int] Action: Integer division (truncating) Exception: DivisionByZero if b == 0

OP_MOD_INT (0x14) Format: [opcode] Stack: [a:int][b:int] → [a%b:int] Action: Integer modulo

OP_NEG_INT (0x15) Format: [opcode] Stack: [a:int] → [-a:int] Action: Integer negation

A.4.2 Floating-Point Arithmetic

OP_ADD_FLOAT (0x16) Format: [opcode] Stack: [a:float][b:float] → [a+b:float] Action: Floating-point addition

OP_SUB_FLOAT (0x17) Format: [opcode] Stack: [a:float][b:float] → [a-b:float] Action: Floating-point subtraction

OP_MUL_FLOAT (0x18) Format: [opcode] Stack: [a:float][b:float] → [a*b:float] Action: Floating-point multiplication

OP_DIV_FLOAT (0x19) Format: [opcode] Stack: [a:float][b:float] → [a/b:float] Action: Floating-point division

A.4.3 Bitwise Operations

OP_AND (0x1A) Format: [opcode] Stack: [a:int][b:int] → [a&b:int] Action: Bitwise AND

OP_OR (0x1B) Format: [opcode] Stack: [a:int][b:int] → [a|b:int] Action: Bitwise OR

OP_XOR (0x1C) Format: [opcode] Stack: [a:int][b:int] → [a^b:int] Action: Bitwise XOR

OP_NOT (0x1D) Format: [opcode] Stack: [a:int] → [~a:int] Action: Bitwise NOT

OP_SHL (0x1E) Format: [opcode] Stack: [a:int][b:int] → [a<<b:int] Action: Shift left

OP_SHR (0x1F) Format: [opcode] Stack: [a:int][b:int] → [a>>b:int] Action: Arithmetic shift right

A.5 Control Flow Instructions

A.5.1 Unconditional Jumps

OP_JUMP (0x20) Format: [opcode][offset:16] Stack: [] → [] Action: PC += offset (signed) Compilation: JUMP label

OP_JUMP_LONG (0x21) Format: [opcode][0][offset:32] Stack: [] → [] Action: PC += offset (32-bit signed) Note: Used for large functions

A.5.2 Conditional Branches

OP_JUMP_IF_TRUE (0x22) Format: [opcode][offset:16] Stack: [cond] → [] Action: if (cond) PC += offset Compilation: codeC(e, ρ, sl, label_true, label_false)

OP_JUMP_IF_FALSE (0x23) Format: [opcode][offset:16] Stack: [cond] → [] Action: if (!cond) PC += offset

OP_JUMP_IF_EQ (0x24) Format: [opcode][offset:16] Stack: [a][b] → [] Action: if (a == b) PC += offset

OP_JUMP_IF_NE (0x25) Format: [opcode][offset:16] Stack: [a][b] → [] Action: if (a != b) PC += offset

OP_JUMP_IF_LT (0x26) Format: [opcode][offset:16] Stack: [a][b] → [] Action: if (a < b) PC += offset

OP_JUMP_IF_LE (0x27) Format: [opcode][offset:16] Stack: [a][b] → [] Action: if (a <= b) PC += offset

A.5.3 Switch/Table Jump

OP_TABLE_SWITCH (0x28) Format: [opcode][default:16][low:16][high:16][...offsets...] Stack: [index] → [] Action: Jump based on table lookup Compilation: Used for dense switch statements

OP_LOOKUP_SWITCH (0x29) Format: [opcode][default:16][npairs:16][...key/offset pairs...] Stack: [key] → [] Action: Binary search for key, then jump Compilation: Used for sparse switch statements

A.6 Function Call Instructions

A.6.1 Call and Return

OP_CALL (0x30) Format: [opcode][argc:8][method_id:16] Stack: [obj][arg1]...[argn] → [result] Action: Invoke method with arguments Frame: Creates new stack frame

OP_CALL_STATIC (0x31) Format: [opcode][argc:8][function_id:16] Stack: [arg1]...[argn] → [result] Action: Call static function Note: No receiver object

OP_CALL_VIRTUAL (0x32) Format: [opcode][argc:8][vtable_index:16] Stack: [obj][arg1]...[argn] → [result] Action: Virtual dispatch through vtable

OP_CALL_INTERFACE (0x33) Format: [opcode][argc:8][interface_id:16] Stack: [obj][arg1]...[argn] → [result] Action: Interface method dispatch

OP_RETURN (0x34) Format: [opcode] Stack: [value] → [] Action: Return from function Frame: Restores previous frame

OP_RETURN_VOID (0x35) Format: [opcode] Stack: [] → [] Action: Return without value

A.6.2 Tail Calls

OP_TAIL_CALL (0x36) Format: [opcode][argc:8][method_id:16] Stack: [obj][arg1]...[argn] → [result] Action: Tail-recursive call (reuses frame) Optimization: No new frame allocation

OP_TAIL_CALL_STATIC (0x37) Format: [opcode][argc:8][function_id:16] Stack: [arg1]...[argn] → [result] Action: Static tail call

A.7 Object and Array Instructions

A.7.1 Object Operations

OP_NEW (0x40) Format: [opcode][class_id:16] Stack: [] → [obj] Action: Allocate new object GC: May trigger collection

OP_GET_FIELD (0x41) Format: [opcode][field_id:16] Stack: [obj] → [value] Action: Read object field

OP_PUT_FIELD (0x42) Format: [opcode][field_id:16] Stack: [obj][value] → [] Action: Write object field

OP_GET_STATIC_FIELD (0x43) Format: [opcode][field_id:16] Stack: [] → [value] Action: Read static field

OP_PUT_STATIC_FIELD (0x44) Format: [opcode][field_id:16] Stack: [value] → [] Action: Write static field

A.7.2 Array Operations

OP_NEW_ARRAY (0x45) Format: [opcode][type:8] Stack: [size] → [array] Action: Allocate array

OP_ARRAY_LENGTH (0x46) Format: [opcode] Stack: [array] → [length] Action: Get array length

OP_ARRAY_LOAD (0x47) Format: [opcode] Stack: [array][index] → [value] Action: Load array element Exception: BoundsCheck if index out of range

OP_ARRAY_STORE (0x48) Format: [opcode] Stack: [array][index][value] → [] Action: Store array element

A.8 Type Instructions

A.8.1 Type Checking

OP_INSTANCEOF (0x50) Format: [opcode][type_id:16] Stack: [obj] → [bool] Action: Test if object is instance of type

OP_CHECKCAST (0x51) Format: [opcode][type_id:16] Stack: [obj] → [obj] Action: Verify cast, throw if invalid Exception: ClassCastException on failure

A.8.2 Type Conversion

OP_INT_TO_FLOAT (0x52) Format: [opcode] Stack: [int] → [float] Action: Convert integer to float

OP_FLOAT_TO_INT (0x53) Format: [opcode] Stack: [float] → [int] Action: Convert float to integer (truncate)

OP_INT_TO_STRING (0x54) Format: [opcode] Stack: [int] → [string] Action: Convert integer to string

OP_BOX (0x55) Format: [opcode][type:8] Stack: [primitive] → [boxed] Action: Box primitive value

OP_UNBOX (0x56) Format: [opcode][type:8] Stack: [boxed] → [primitive] Action: Unbox to primitive

A.9 Exception Handling Instructions

A.9.1 Exception Control Flow

OP_THROW (0x60) Format: [opcode] Stack: [exception] → [] Action: Throw exception Frame: Unwinds stack to handler

OP_MONITOR_ENTER (0x61) Format: [opcode] Stack: [obj] → [] Action: Acquire object monitor Sync: May block on contention

OP_MONITOR_EXIT (0x62) Format: [opcode] Stack: [obj] → [] Action: Release object monitor Exception: IllegalMonitorState if not owned

A.10 Specialized Instructions

A.10.1 Quick Instructions (After Resolution)

OP_GET_FIELD_QUICK (0x70) Format: [opcode][offset:16] Stack: [obj] → [value] Action: Direct field access (resolved) Note: Replaces GET_FIELD after first execution

OP_PUT_FIELD_QUICK (0x71) Format: [opcode][offset:16] Stack: [obj][value] → [] Action: Direct field write (resolved)

OP_INVOKE_VIRTUAL_QUICK (0x72) Format: [opcode][vtable_offset:16] Stack: [obj][

Appendix B: C API Documentation

B.1 Introduction

This appendix provides comprehensive documentation for Diyrbal's C API, enabling native extension development and embedding of the VM into host applications. The API follows consistent naming conventions and memory management patterns to ensure safety and ease of use.

B.2 Core VM API

B.2.1 VM Initialization and Lifecycle

/* VM instance management */
typedef struct DiyrbalVM DiyrbalVM;
typedef struct DiyrbalConfig DiyrbalConfig;

/* Create and configure VM */
DiyrbalConfig* dyr_config_new(void);
void dyr_config_set_heap_size(DiyrbalConfig* config, size_t min, size_t max);
void dyr_config_set_stack_size(DiyrbalConfig* config, size_t size);
void dyr_config_set_gc_threshold(DiyrbalConfig* config, size_t threshold);
void dyr_config_enable_jit(DiyrbalConfig* config, bool enable);
void dyr_config_set_optimization_level(DiyrbalConfig* config, int level);
void dyr_config_free(DiyrbalConfig* config);

/* VM lifecycle */
DiyrbalVM* dyr_vm_create(DiyrbalConfig* config);
int dyr_vm_initialize(DiyrbalVM* vm);
void dyr_vm_shutdown(DiyrbalVM* vm);
void dyr_vm_destroy(DiyrbalVM* vm);

/* Error handling */
typedef enum {
    DYR_OK = 0,
    DYR_ERROR_OOM = -1,
    DYR_ERROR_INVALID_ARG = -2,
    DYR_ERROR_TYPE_MISMATCH = -3,
    DYR_ERROR_NULL_POINTER = -4,
    DYR_ERROR_INDEX_BOUNDS = -5,
    DYR_ERROR_RUNTIME = -6,
    DYR_ERROR_COMPILATION = -7
} DyrStatus;

const char* dyr_error_string(DyrStatus status);
DyrStatus dyr_get_last_error(DiyrbalVM* vm);
const char* dyr_get_error_message(DiyrbalVM* vm);

B.2.2 Thread Management

/* Thread context */
typedef struct DyrThread DyrThread;

/* Thread operations */
DyrThread* dyr_thread_current(DiyrbalVM* vm);
DyrThread* dyr_thread_create(DiyrbalVM* vm, const char* name);
DyrStatus dyr_thread_start(DyrThread* thread, DyrValue* callable, 
                          DyrValue* args, int argc);
DyrStatus dyr_thread_join(DyrThread* thread, DyrValue** result);
void dyr_thread_yield(void);
bool dyr_thread_is_alive(DyrThread* thread);
void dyr_thread_interrupt(DyrThread* thread);

/* Thread-local storage */
DyrStatus dyr_thread_set_local(DyrThread* thread, const char* key, 
                               DyrValue* value);
DyrValue* dyr_thread_get_local(DyrThread* thread, const char* key);

B.3 Value System API

B.3.1 Value Types and Creation

/* Value handle */
typedef struct DyrValue DyrValue;

/* Type enumeration */
typedef enum {
    DYR_TYPE_NULL,
    DYR_TYPE_BOOLEAN,
    DYR_TYPE_INTEGER,
    DYR_TYPE_FLOAT,
    DYR_TYPE_STRING,
    DYR_TYPE_OBJECT,
    DYR_TYPE_ARRAY,
    DYR_TYPE_FUNCTION,
    DYR_TYPE_CLASS,
    DYR_TYPE_NATIVE_POINTER
} DyrType;

/* Type checking */
DyrType dyr_value_type(DyrValue* value);
bool dyr_value_is_null(DyrValue* value);
bool dyr_value_is_boolean(DyrValue* value);
bool dyr_value_is_number(DyrValue* value);
bool dyr_value_is_string(DyrValue* value);
bool dyr_value_is_object(DyrValue* value);
bool dyr_value_is_array(DyrValue* value);
bool dyr_value_is_function(DyrValue* value);
bool dyr_value_is_instance_of(DyrValue* value, DyrValue* class_value);

/* Primitive value creation */
DyrValue* dyr_null(DiyrbalVM* vm);
DyrValue* dyr_boolean(DiyrbalVM* vm, bool value);
DyrValue* dyr_integer(DiyrbalVM* vm, int64_t value);
DyrValue* dyr_float(DiyrbalVM* vm, double value);
DyrValue* dyr_string(DiyrbalVM* vm, const char* str);
DyrValue* dyr_string_n(DiyrbalVM* vm, const char* str, size_t len);

B.3.2 Value Conversion

/* Extract C values */
bool dyr_to_boolean(DyrValue* value, bool* result);
bool dyr_to_integer(DyrValue* value, int64_t* result);
bool dyr_to_float(DyrValue* value, double* result);
bool dyr_to_string(DyrValue* value, const char** result, size_t* len);
bool dyr_to_cstring(DyrValue* value, char* buffer, size_t buffer_size);

/* String operations */
size_t dyr_string_length(DyrValue* string);
const char* dyr_string_data(DyrValue* string);
DyrValue* dyr_string_concat(DiyrbalVM* vm, DyrValue* s1, DyrValue* s2);
DyrValue* dyr_string_substring(DiyrbalVM* vm, DyrValue* str, 
                               size_t start, size_t len);

/* Type conversion */
DyrValue* dyr_convert_to_string(DiyrbalVM* vm, DyrValue* value);
DyrValue* dyr_convert_to_number(DiyrbalVM* vm, DyrValue* value);
DyrValue* dyr_convert_to_boolean(DiyrbalVM* vm, DyrValue* value);

B.4 Object and Class API

B.4.1 Class Definition

/* Class builder */
typedef struct DyrClassBuilder DyrClassBuilder;

/* Class creation */
DyrClassBuilder* dyr_class_builder_new(DiyrbalVM* vm, const char* name);
void dyr_class_set_super(DyrClassBuilder* builder, DyrValue* super_class);
void dyr_class_add_field(DyrClassBuilder* builder, const char* name, 
                         DyrType type, bool is_static);
void dyr_class_add_method(DyrClassBuilder* builder, const char* name,
                         DyrNativeMethod method, int argc, bool is_static);
void dyr_class_add_property(DyrClassBuilder* builder, const char* name,
                           DyrNativeGetter getter, DyrNativeSetter setter);
DyrValue* dyr_class_build(DyrClassBuilder* builder);
void dyr_class_builder_free(DyrClassBuilder* builder);

/* Class introspection */
const char* dyr_class_name(DyrValue* class_value);
DyrValue* dyr_class_get_super(DyrValue* class_value);
bool dyr_class_has_field(DyrValue* class_value, const char* name);
bool dyr_class_has_method(DyrValue* class_value, const char* name);
DyrValue* dyr_class_get_method(DyrValue* class_value, const char* name);

B.4.2 Object Operations

/* Object creation and field access */
DyrValue* dyr_object_new(DiyrbalVM* vm, DyrValue* class_value);
DyrValue* dyr_object_get_field(DyrValue* object, const char* field);
DyrStatus dyr_object_set_field(DyrValue* object, const char* field, 
                               DyrValue* value);
DyrValue* dyr_object_get_class(DyrValue* object);

/* Property access (triggers getters/setters) */
DyrValue* dyr_object_get_property(DyrValue* object, const char* property);
DyrStatus dyr_object_set_property(DyrValue* object, const char* property,
                                  DyrValue* value);

/* Method invocation */
DyrValue* dyr_object_call_method(DyrValue* object, const char* method,
                                 DyrValue** args, int argc);

B.5 Array API

B.5.1 Array Operations

/* Array creation */
DyrValue* dyr_array_new(DiyrbalVM* vm, size_t length);
DyrValue* dyr_array_new_typed(DiyrbalVM* vm, DyrType element_type, 
                              size_t length);
DyrValue* dyr_array_from_values(DiyrbalVM* vm, DyrValue** values, 
                                size_t count);

/* Array access */
size_t dyr_array_length(DyrValue* array);
DyrValue* dyr_array_get(DyrValue* array, size_t index);
DyrStatus dyr_array_set(DyrValue* array, size_t index, DyrValue* value);

/* Array manipulation */
DyrStatus dyr_array_push(DyrValue* array, DyrValue* value);
DyrValue* dyr_array_pop(DyrValue* array);
DyrStatus dyr_array_insert(DyrValue* array, size_t index, DyrValue* value);
DyrStatus dyr_array_remove(DyrValue* array, size_t index);
DyrValue* dyr_array_slice(DiyrbalVM* vm, DyrValue* array, 
                         size_t start, size_t end);

/* Array utilities */
void dyr_array_sort(DyrValue* array, DyrCompareFunc compare);
DyrValue* dyr_array_map(DiyrbalVM* vm, DyrValue* array, 
                       DyrMapFunc mapper);
DyrValue* dyr_array_filter(DiyrbalVM* vm, DyrValue* array, 
                          DyrFilterFunc predicate);

B.6 Function API

B.6.1 Native Function Registration

/* Native function signature */
typedef DyrValue* (*DyrNativeFunc)(DiyrbalVM* vm, DyrValue* this, 
                                   DyrValue** args, int argc);
typedef DyrValue* (*DyrNativeMethod)(DyrValue* this, DyrValue** args, 
                                     int argc);
typedef DyrValue* (*DyrNativeGetter)(DyrValue* this);
typedef void (*DyrNativeSetter)(DyrValue* this, DyrValue* value);

/* Function registration */
DyrStatus dyr_register_function(DiyrbalVM* vm, const char* name,
                                DyrNativeFunc func, int min_args, 
                                int max_args);
DyrStatus dyr_register_module_function(DiyrbalVM* vm, const char* module,
                                       const char* name, DyrNativeFunc func,
                                       int min_args, int max_args);

/* Function metadata */
typedef struct {
    const char* name;
    const char* signature;
    const char* doc_string;
    bool is_variadic;
} DyrFunctionInfo;

void dyr_function_set_info(DyrValue* func, const DyrFunctionInfo* info);
const DyrFunctionInfo* dyr_function_get_info(DyrValue* func);

B.6.2 Function Invocation

/* Call functions */
DyrValue* dyr_call(DyrValue* callable, DyrValue** args, int argc);
DyrValue* dyr_call_method(DyrValue* object, const char* method,
                         DyrValue** args, int argc);
DyrValue* dyr_apply(DyrValue* callable, DyrValue* arg_array);

/* Protected calls (catch exceptions) */
typedef struct {
    DyrValue* result;
    DyrValue* exception;
    const char* error_message;
} DyrCallResult;

DyrCallResult dyr_pcall(DyrValue* callable, DyrValue** args, int argc);
DyrCallResult dyr_pcall_method(DyrValue* object, const char* method,
                               DyrValue** args, int argc);

B.7 Memory Management API

B.7.1 Handle Management

/* Handle creation and management */
typedef struct DyrHandle DyrHandle;

DyrHandle* dyr_handle_new(DiyrbalVM* vm, DyrValue* value);
void dyr_handle_free(DyrHandle* handle);
DyrValue* dyr_handle_get(DyrHandle* handle);
void dyr_handle_set(DyrHandle* handle, DyrValue* value);

/* Handle scopes for automatic cleanup */
typedef struct DyrHandleScope DyrHandleScope;

DyrHandleScope* dyr_handle_scope_new(DiyrbalVM* vm);
void dyr_handle_scope_close(DyrHandleScope* scope);
DyrValue* dyr_handle_scope_add(DyrHandleScope* scope, DyrValue* value);

/* Convenience macro for handle scopes */
#define DYR_WITH_HANDLE_SCOPE(vm, scope_var) \
    for (DyrHandleScope* scope_var = dyr_handle_scope_new(vm); \
         scope_var; \
         dyr_handle_scope_close(scope_var), scope_var = NULL)

B.7.2 GC Control

/* GC operations */
void dyr_gc_collect(DiyrbalVM* vm);
void dyr_gc_collect_full(DiyrbalVM* vm);
size_t dyr_gc_memory_used(DiyrbalVM* vm);
size_t dyr_gc_memory_limit(DiyrbalVM* vm);
void dyr_gc_set_memory_limit(DiyrbalVM* vm, size_t limit);

/* GC control */
void dyr_gc_disable(DiyrbalVM* vm);
void dyr_gc_enable(DiyrbalVM* vm);
bool dyr_gc_is_enabled(DiyrbalVM* vm);

/* Root management */
void dyr_gc_add_root(DiyrbalVM* vm, DyrValue* value);
void dyr_gc_remove_root(DiyrbalVM* vm, DyrValue* value);

/* Weak references */
typedef void (*DyrWeakCallback)(DyrValue* value, void* data);
void dyr_gc_make_weak(DyrValue* value, DyrWeakCallback callback, 
                      void* data);

B.8 Module System API

B.8.1 Module Management

/* Module operations */
typedef struct DyrModule DyrModule;

DyrModule* dyr_module_create(DiyrbalVM* vm, const char* name);
DyrStatus dyr_module_load(DiyrbalVM* vm, const char* path);
DyrStatus dyr_module_load_source(DiyrbalVM* vm, const char* name,
                                 const char* source);
DyrModule* dyr_module_get(DiyrbalVM* vm, const char* name);

/* Module exports */
DyrStatus dyr_module_export_value(DyrModule* module, const char* name,
                                  DyrValue* value);
DyrStatus dyr_module_export_function(DyrModule* module, const char* name,
                                     DyrNativeFunc func, int min_args,
                                     int max_args);
DyrStatus dyr_module_export_class(DyrModule* module, const char* name,
                                  DyrValue* class_value);

/* Module imports */
DyrValue* dyr_module_import(DiyrbalVM* vm, const char* module
